dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy on the radio said it's gonna get  down to thirty-four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches a woman on the sidewalk pause to tighten th scarf around her neck. She looks in the window, sees Chil looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-four -– that's freezing, for  Christ sake. (then) Yo, Chili, you're spacin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili turns and studies Tommy a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're closing the Granview. You  know, theater down on Biscayne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the guy owes Momo a few G's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm thinkin' is maybe Momo could  buy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momo could buy it, I could run it  for him. Show some Cagney films.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Momo gonna want with an old  place, shows old movies people don't  care about no more. Outside of maybe  turnin' it into a porno house, I  don't think he's gonna give much of  a fuck. And you already got a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks back out the window again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear LAUGHTER OFF SCREEN and then FOCUS on the window that Chili can now see a GROUP OF MEN reflected there, si at a table nearby. We hear MORE LAUGHTER and now Chili tu and looks over at...

dialogues.speaker: RAY "BONES" BARBONI
dialogues.text: Mob guy: tall, loud suit with lots of jewelry. As he gets from the table, the other men around the table follow his lead as he finishes up some jokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so the guy says, I'm not the  tailor, I'm the undertaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh again, more out of respect than appreciatio Ray Bones turns, sees... Chili and Tommy sitting in their booth. Tommy, sucking on toothpick, waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray. How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Tommy. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones focuses on Chili, waits for acknowledgement. But Ch turns back to the window. Always the peacemaker, Tommy sm at Bones again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe this weather, Ray? Miami  Beach, for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Chili Palmer. (smiles) Chilly outside. Chili inside. It's a  regular fuckin' chili-fest. Hey,  waiter -– give Mr. Chili Pepper a  big fuckin' bowl of chili!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the men all laugh respectfully at Ray Bone's stupid joke. Chili smiles the best he can at the idiot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the window, watches Ray Bones in the  reflection, still cracking up as he and his men head for front of the restaurant. Tommy looks at Chili for a momen then stands up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done starin' out the window,  I'll see you back at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods, but still doesn't turn from the window. He me watches in the glass as Tommy turns up his collar and ste out into the cold Miami day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's freezin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili then puts out the cigarette, nods to the waiter who comes over with the check. INT. RESTAURANT COATROOM – A FEW MINUTES LATER From inside the tiny room. A couple of ratty rain coats a an old flight jacket hang to one side in immediate foregr as Chili steps into the doorway and freezes. He looks o.s and whistles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later the MANAGER, an old Italian guy in a black suit, joins him in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager peers into the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see a black leather jacket,  fingertip length, like the one Pacino  wore in Serpico? You don't, you owe  me three seventy-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't see my sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager points to a sign on the wall: "WE CANNOT BE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't come down to sunny  Florida to freeze my ass. You follow  me? You get the coat back or you  give me the three seventy-nine my ex- wife paid for it at Alexander's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manager looks OFF SCREEN, and begins speaking in Ital Chili reacts as we hear the name RAY BARBONI mentioned a  couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain to him how Mr. Barboni borrow  the coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER joins Chili and the Manager in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones took my coat? Just now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't take it. He borrow it.  See, someone took his coat, you  know... (indicates flight  jacket) ...leave this old one. So Mr. Barboni,  he put on this other coat that fit  him pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was wearing it, you know, to go  home. He wasn't gonna keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My car keys were in that coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call you a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme get this straight. You aren't  responsible for any lost articles  like an expensive coat of mine, but  you're gonna find Ray Bones' coat or  get him a new one? Is that what you're  telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Barboni is a good customer. (making sure to add) Works for Jimmy Capp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who he works for. Where's  your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. TOMMY CARLO'S CAR – DAY Tommy drives. Chili stares straight ahead, rubs his hands together, tries to stay warm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it was Ray Bones took the  coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the guy said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous now) Tomorrow, I see on the TV weather,  it's gonna be nice and warm. You  won't need the coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili points out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. VICTOR HOTEL – DAY As Tommy pulls up out front. INT. CAR – SAME TIME Tommy looks up at the hotel as Chili takes a pair of leat gloves from top of the dash, opens the door. Tommy looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chili. (Chili pauses) Get your coat, but don't piss the  guy off, okay? It could get  complicated and we'd have to call  Momo to straighten it out. Then Momo  gets pissed for wasting his time and  we don't need that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. I won't say  any more than I have to, if that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. STAIRS – DAY Chili pulls on the gloves as he goes up the stairs to the third floor. EXT. DOOR – DAY As Chili knocks on the door three times. He waits, pulls right-hand glove on tight, so that when RAY BONES opens t door, Chili nails him. One punch. No need to throw the le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... Oh, God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili then steps over him into the room and grabs his coa from a chair. He looks over at Ray Bones bent over, blood running from his nose and mouth, blood all over his hands his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili walks out. Doesn't say one word to Ray Bones. EXT. BARBER SHOP – DAY A warmer day. The sun is shining. All is quiet. INT. BARBER SHOP – SAME TIME The place is empty except for FRED and ED, the two old ba sitting in the chairs, reading newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been there, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BARBER SHOP BACKROOM – SAME TIME A room Tommy and Chili use as an office. Chili sits at th desk making entries in the collection book. We can hear t two old barbers talking OFF SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris? Yeah, I been there plenty  times. It's right offa Seventy-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell it is. It's on Sixty-eight.  Seventeen miles from Lexington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about, Paris,  Kentucky, or Paris, Tennessee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. No answer to the question. Chili look up from th collection book, listens a moment to nothing. He opens the desk drawer and pulls out a .38. He aims the gun at the open doorway...

dialogues.speaker: OVER CHILI'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As Ray Bones, a bandage on his nose, appears in the back  hall, then the doorway to the office, his face showing  surprise to see a gun aimed at him... Ray Bones begins firing the big Colt auto in his hand, ma before he's ready, the gun making an awful racket, when C pulls the trigger, shooting Ray Bones along the top of hi head, creasing him from hairline to crown. Chili calmly gets to his feet. Aims once more -– probably lower this time -– but doesn't fire as Ray Bones grabs hi head and stumbles out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody call 9 fucking 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MIAMI HARBOR – DAY Ray Bones, a bandage on his head now as well as his nose, sits on a cigarette boat with his boss, JIMMY CAP and two bikini clad BABES, both of whom rub lotion on Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you want me to do Ray? Go to  war over a fuckin coat? You're lucky  the guy didn't kill you. The coat  was a Christmas present for Christ's  sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do somethin', Jimmy. This  man's got no respect for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got no respect for you, and I  don't gotta do shit. Chili Palmer  don't work for me, he works for Momo  up in Brooklyn. So as long as Momo's  around, nothing happens to Chili  Palmer. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an angry Ray Bones sits back, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BROOKLYN STREET – NIGHT We TILT DOWN to REVEAL a dark Brooklyn street as a black  Cadillac pulls to a stop in front of an older building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momo. We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two big guys, BODYGUARDS, get out of the car. One of them opens the back door for a huge man, MOMO, who gets out of the car and looks up at the dark building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You check this place out good? If  I'm going up alone, I don't want no  surprises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked it out, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BROOKLYN TENEMENT BUILDING – NIGHT Momo eyes the bodyguards -– both nervous -– then starts u the steps. We follow Momo as he enters the building, goes the dark stairwell... up one flight... we're behind him t whole time... When he gets to the top floor, Momo pauses to catch his  breath, before moving on down the hall to a door. Momo kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Momo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momo slowly opens the door... when, suddenly, the apartme is FLOODED WITH LIGHT so that we see a room full of PEOPL a banner on the back wall reading "HAPPY SIXTY-FIFTH, MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as Momo drops to his knees, gurgles something we  can't understand and falls over. Suddenly a dozen faces a looking down on us as we then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BARBER SHOP – DAY A beautiful day in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're you tellin' me, you're  never gonna go to sleep again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BARBER SHOP – DAY Chili and Tommy each sit in a barber chair, reading the  newspaper while Fred and Ed sit nearby playing checkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I said I'm never goin' to bed.  There's a difference. See, the article  says most people die in their beds.  I figure long as I stay outta bed,  I'm safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the dumbest thing I ever heard.  Where do you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an armchair. Or I go to a coffee  shop, sleep there. Sit in a booth,  pull my hat down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up. Chili's no longer listening to Tommy, but now watching as Ray Bones and a BLACK GUY get out of the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people you hear ever die in  a coffee shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks over as Ray Bones -– smaller bandage on the t of his head -– and his man enter the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut straight hair in this place,  or just fags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bones, looks like you're gonna  have a nice scar up there. Maybe  these guys can fit you with a rug,  cover it up for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones eyes Chili, then nods to Fred and Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you geezers take your game  over to the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guys leave as the Black Guy steps up to Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is the man, you understand  what I'm saying? He's Mr. Bones, you  speak to him from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili exchanges a look with Tommy, watches as 'Mr. Bones' goes down the hall into the back office, then turns to th black guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better'n him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not these days. Not less you can  talk Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones comes out with the collection book open, lookin at all of the names of who owes what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a miss. Leo Devoe. Guy's six  weeks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know he died, he tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones checks his man to get some appreciation, but th guy's too busy looking at the hair rinses and shit on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ray, he personally told me he  got killed in that Get Away Airlines'  jet went down last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Get Away jet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in the Herald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, maybe the guy took out  flight insurance. Check with the  wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's your book now. You want to  check it out, go ahead. He's got a  dry cleaning business out on Federal  Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy gives Chili a look as the Black Guy comes over to C stands next to him. Ray Bones steps over to Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momo's dead. Which means anything  was his now belongs to Jimmy Capp,  including you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy watches as the Black Guy picks up a pair of scissor runs his hand along the edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which also means when I speak, I'm  speakin' for Jimmy. So e.g. as of  now, you start affording me the proper  respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'E.g.' means 'for example', Ray. I  think what you wanna say is 'i.e.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. E.g. is short for 'ergo'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask your man here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones looks at the Black Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best a my knowledge, e.g. means 'for  example.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.g., i.e., fuck you. The point is,  I say jump, you say okay. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Chili) Yeah, Ray. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones then nods to his man who grabs Chili, holds the point of the scissors to Chili's throat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me the dry cleaner's fifteen  grand plus the juice which is what  another, uhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty seven hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. You either get it from the  wife or out of your own pocket, I  don't give a fuck. You don't ever  hand me a book with a miss in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray throws the book at Chili and walks out, his man right behind him. Chili looks over at Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say a fuckin' word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FAY DEVOE'S BACKYARD – DUSK Where Chili sits with FAY DEVOE -– thirties, attractive, a sundress -– on her patio. They each have a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the dry cleaning business. I  hate being inside all day, around  all those machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea how hot it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Touches her drink to the side of her fa Chili finishes his drink, sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering, Fay, if Leo had any  life insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know of any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit there in silence a moment. Fay reaches over, put hand on his leg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you, Chili. I think you're a  decent type of man, even if you are  a crook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Fay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally looks at Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he really was dead, the son  of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LAS VEGAS – NIGHT The strip. Mesas Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo Devoe. Standing with Fay at Epcot Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him all right.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL...
dialogues.text: INT. DICK ALLEN'S OFFICE – NIGHT A sign on the door reads "DICK ALLEN, CUSTOMER RELATIONS. bank of video monitors show the floor of the casino. Chil sits across the desk from DICK ALLEN – lots of jewelry, a giant NEON COWGIRL out the window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called himself Larry DeMille. Hit on  every showgirl in town. Would tell  'em he was the 'Martinizing King of  Miami'. What a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns the snapshot to Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, you want this guy, he's in  L.A. We put him on a flight after he  spanked one a my cocktail girls in  the Keno room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo spanked a waitress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, way it went, he invited  her to come to Santa Anita to play  the ponies with him. She told him  what to do with that and he gave her  one on the tush. My guess, he's by  his lonesome at the track right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chil? Since you're goin' out to  L.A. anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy owes us a hundred and fifty grand,  sixty days over; a movie producer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movie producer? Yeah, why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dick Allen reaches for a pad of paper, we hear THE SOU OF AN AIRPLANE OVER... EXT. LAX RENTAL CAR LOT – NIGHT It's raining as we TILT DOWN from a LANDING AIRPLANE to a National Car Rental BUS arriving next to a tan MINIVAN. C eyes the car a moment, then turns to the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Oldsmobile Silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I reserved a Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, this one's the Cadillac  of minivans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want La Tierra Rent-A-Car  just over there, but I think all  they got are Rabbit convertibles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili gives the driver a look then gets out of the bus,  standing there in the rain, his seat getting wet, nowhere go. He turns and stares at the minivan... EXT. KAREN FLORES' HOUSE – NIGHT All the lights are out, save the BLUE GLOW of a televisio coming from one of the downstairs rooms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN FLORES' BEDROOM – NIGHT As KAREN FLORES, pretty, endowed, sits up in bed wearing Lakers T-shirt, nothing else. She looks at the big shape  lying under the covers beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape doesn't move. She shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, God damn it, somebody's  downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shape stirs, rolls over, and we see HARRY ZIMM, baldi overweight; a movie producer. He sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear VOICES downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh -– there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now LAUGHTER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I came upstairs, you stayed to  finish your drink. I told you to  turn off the TV when you were through. (an afterthought) Come to think of it, I also told you  you could sleep in the maid's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I turned off the set. I  used the remote control thing and  laid it on the floor. You know what  could've happened? The dog came in  and stepped on it, turned the TV  back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't? What happened to Muff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, are you going down, or you  want me to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grunts, gets out of bed. Starts looking around the roo for his clothes. Harry looks out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone skim the pool? It needs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HALLWAY – SAME TIME The MONOTONE VOICES become louder and more distinct as Ha moves down the curved staircase in his shirt and boxer sh One of the voices is familiar... We can see this is a nice place as Harry crosses the entr hall to a doorway, the FLICKERING LIGHT of the television emitting from inside the room. Harry listens at the door. Yeah, it's David Letterman. INT. KAREN'S STUDY – SAME TIME Harry moves into the glow of the big Sony, the rest of th room dark. On the tube, Dave is interviewing actor Martin Weir when suddenly the screen goes black and the desk lam comes on. Harry jumps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili leans into the light, keeps his tone quiet, control

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Zimm, how you doing? I'm Chili  Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry presses a hand against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, if I have a heart attack, I  hope you know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lets his hand slide down over his belly, taking his time, wanting to show that he has it together now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met? I don't recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just did. I told you my name's  Chili Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stares back, trying to figure out who this guy is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in pictures, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili smiles. Doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you stop to think what if I had  a heart attack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look okay to me, Harry. Come  over here and sit down. Tell me what  you been up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry takes one of the canvas director's chairs by the de He looks at a bottle of Dewars sitting there, runs a hand through his hair, thinks about a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry brings his hand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to keep looking right  here, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Dick Allen, Mesa's Casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Allen's a very dear friend of  mine. How far you want to go with  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're there, Harry. You signed markers  for a hundred and a half, you're  over sixty days past due and you  haven't told anybody what the problem  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what're you, a collector  for a fucking casino? You come in  here, walk in the house in the middle  of the fucking night? I thought you  were an actor, auditioning, for  Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods, almost smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? That's interesting.  You thought I was acting, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pushes out of the chair, looks down at Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry grabs the phone, punches the '0'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator, how do I get Las Vegas  Information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, lemme give you some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili leans forward, hangs up the phone with his index fi casually reaches for the receiver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to act like a hard- on, you're standing there in your  undies. You know what I'm saying?  What you want to do is sit down and  talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits down. Chili hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A marker's like a check, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what a marker is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't want to deposit yours and  have it bounce. That annoys them. So  your dear friend Dick Allen's been  calling, leaving messages on your  machine, but you never get back to  him. I happen to be in Vegas on  another matter, and Dick asks me as  a favor would I look you up. I follow  you over here, see you in the window  with this woman, looks a lot like  that actress Karen Flores, was in  Grotesque, except she's not blond  anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's gaze moves to the bottle of scotch on the desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not looking at me, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to keep looking at  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna get rough now, threaten  me? I make good by tomorrow or get  my legs broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Harry -– Mesas? The worst  they might do is get a judgment  against you, uttering a bad check. I  can't imagine you want that to happen,  man in your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' basketball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry reaches for the bottle of scotch and pours himself  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Dick Allen I'll cover the markers  in the next sixty days at the most.  He doesn't like it, that's his  problem. The prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry starts to take another drink, looks at Chili, not  moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you want me to call you a cab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili shakes his head, keeps staring at Harry, but with a different expression now, more thoughtful, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make movies, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I produce feature motion pictures,  no TV. You mentioned Grotesque, that  happened to be Grotesque Part II  that Karen Flores was in. She starred  in all three of my Slime Creatures  releases you might have seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods, leans forward on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I got an idea for a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN FLORES' BEDROOM – NIGHT Karen is sitting up in bed, listening. We hear the muffle sounds of Chili and Harry talking downstairs. She gets ou of bed... INT. HALLWAY – SAME TIME Chili and Harry's conversation gets louder as Karen desce the stairs. She peers into the study, but they're not in  there... INT. KITCHEN – SAME TIME Chili sits with Harry at a butcher block table, a bottle Dewars and a couple of glasses now between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Leo wore these little plaid  hats -– Miami, middle of the summer,  this guy thinks no one's gonna notice  he's balding, he wears a fuckin'  hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks up past Chili, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili turns aronud and sees her standing in the doorway n her arms folded across that chest, the Lakers T-shirt com down just past her crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, say hello to Chili Palmer.  Chili, this is Karen Flores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, it's a pleasure. How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling me an idea for a movie.  It's not bad so far. (motions with his  glass) Sit down, have a drink. (to Chili) Tell Karen, let's see what she thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you didn't hear me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door from the patio, in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was open. It wasn't locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili doesn't say anything, just watches her, likes the w she's handling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to hear this idea? It's  about a dry cleaner who scams an  airline out of three hundred grand.  Go on, tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, the way you told it to me.  Start at the beginning, we see how  the story line develops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Karen. She leans in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, basically, this guy owes a  shylock fifteen thousand, plus he's  a few weeks behind on the vig, the  interest you have to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what a vig is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the kind of situation, you don't  pay, you get your legs broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the guy thinks he could get 'em  broken. You have to understand the  loan shark's in business the same as  anybody else. He isn't in it to hurt  people. He's in it to make money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LEO DEVOE'S HOUSE – DAY As we see Chili talking to Fay on the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the dry cleaner, we'll call him  Leo, he's scared, doesn't know any  better, so he takes off –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S KITCHEN – NIGHT As Harry jumps in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Miami. He's going to Vegas.  He's got a few bucks and he's thinking  it's his only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AIRPLANE – DAY We see a fidgety LEO DEVOE, a little guy in a crummy suit and a little green hat sitting there in coach, looking ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo gets on a plane, ready to go,  but the plane sits there at the gate,  doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Leo sits a BRAT with his MOM and DAD. The parents trying to entertain the kid with the G.I. Joes, other stu they've brought along, but the kid spots Leo's hat as Leo looks up to listen to an announcement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They announce over the PA there's  some kind of mechanical problem,  they'll be there maybe an hour, but  keep your seats in case they get it  fixed sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo gets really uncomfortable now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's nervous, in no shape to  just sit there, sweat it out. So he  gets off the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leo gets up from his seat, the kid knocks off Leo's li green hat, and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MIAMI AIRPORT COCKTAIL LOUNGE – DAY As Leo downs a drink, looks around for the waitress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes in the cocktail lounge and starts  throwing 'em down, one after the  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's motioning to her for another, when we see a PLANE ta past the window in the b.g...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the plane pulls away from the  gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S KITCHEN – NIGHT As Harry interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without him. The guy's so out of it  he doesn't even know it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. As a matter of fact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. COCKTAIL LOUNGE – DAY A shit-faced Leo struggles to keep his head up as he watc the waitress look out the window and gasp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still in the lounge when a plane  blows up on the runway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a BIG FIREBALL in the b.g. as Leo's head hits the  table. INT. KAREN'S KITCHEN – NIGHT As Chili lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when the guy finds out it was his  flight, he can't believe it. If he'd  stayed on that plane, he'd be dead.  Right then he knows his luck has  changed. If everybody thinks he's  dead he won't have to pay back the  fifteen or what he owes on the vig,  four and a half a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili offers the pack to Karen. Karen doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interest is four hundred and  fifty dollars a week on fifteen  thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Three percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a week. That's a hundred and  fifty percent a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty-six. Some'll  charge you more'n that, go as high  as six for five on a short-term loan.  So three a week's not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, keeps her arms folded. Chili watches her, likes the way she's giving it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since Leo's name was on the  passenger list...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AIRPORT HANGER – DAY As an FFA OFFICIAL leads Fay, a black veil over her face, amongst tables full of charred items...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bring his wife out to the airport  where they're going through personal  effects, whatever wasn't burned up.  Leo's bags were on the plane, so the  wife tells 'em what to look for,  things only she would know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAY REACTS as the FFA guy points to a LITTLE GREEN HAT on one of the tables. She grabs it, clutches it to her chest pretends to faint. INT. KAREN'S KITCHEN – NIGHT As Karen finds herself listening, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple days ago by, people from  the airliner come to see his wife,  tell her how sorry they are and all  that their plane exploded and offer  her a settlement, the amount based  on what he would've earned operating  the dry cleaner's the rest of his  life. Leo had some kind of trouble  with his kidneys, so they were giving  him about ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is the wife offered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili starts to speak, but Harry cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred grand, and they take  it, money in hand, babe. The guy has  his wife cash the check and he takes  off for Las Vegas with the dough.  Gets there, he's supposed to call  her, tell her when to come out. But  she never hears from him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the guy's hot, runs the three hundred up to ha a million...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to L.A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry raises his hand to stop Chili. He's rolling, turns Karen now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It drives the guy nuts, he's winning  but can't tell anybody who he is.  You show in a back story his  motivation, his desire to be famous,  you know, pal around with celebrities,  the headliners doing the big rooms.  Now he's got the dough to buy his  way in, mix with celebs and he can't  resist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry then turns back to Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he comes to L.A...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about his wanting to  meet celebrities, that's something  new. But, yeah, he comes to L.A.  Then after that, I don't know what  happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Karen. Patient. Not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? That's your movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I had an idea, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's half a movie, with holes in  it. Maybe forty minutes of screen  time. You don't even have a girl, a  female lead, and on top of that,  there's no one to sympathize with,  you don't have a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shylock's the good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shylock? He's barely mentioned.  And it's not believable the wife  would get a settlement that fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry doesn't realize it's a true  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Miami flight that went down, it  was on the news every day for about  a week. Harry must've been busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you got the idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of it, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, you're not the guy,  are you? The dry cleaner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be talking to me if you  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the guy, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you work for the casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out here looking for Leo. I just  looked you up as a favor to your  dear friend, Dick Allen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't work for the casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, for God's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the shylock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's staring at Chili again. Harry turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right, that's what you do  for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did till recently. (looking at Karen) After I get done here I'll think  about what I'm gonna do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your experience, you could always  become an agent. Right, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what we need. More  agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I got an audition tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. You go on off to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at the two of them sitting there. Not about t move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying, Harry, is I want  you and your new buddy to get out of  my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him, turns and walks out. Chili watches her go. Harry watches Chili, pours the last of the scotch into Ch glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine in your line of work, there  were times you had to get rough, you  know, say one of your customers  stopped paying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry nods, thinks a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pack a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a few times I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever shot anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You ever been arrested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been picked up a couple times.  Loan sharking. Racketeering. But I  was never convicted. I'm clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racketeering, that covers a lot of  ground, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get to the point, Harry?  You want me to do something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FAY DEVOE'S HOUSE – MORNING As a Cadillac Eldorado pulls up out front and Ray Bones a his man get out, check out the neighborhood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Ray, a friend of Chili  Palmer's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. FAY DEVOE'S HOUSE – MORNING Fay watches as Ray Bones and his man go through her thing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to Mr. Palmer since  your husband... you know, blew up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe once or twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over) What was it you talked about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing really? This and that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones hits Fay Devoe in the face. She drops to her kn and cries out. Ray Bones crouches down in front of her, p a hand in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fay... (pulls her head up) Fay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Afraid now, her nose is bleeding. Ray B smiles at her, strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fay, I want us to be friends. And  friends don't hit each other, 'less  they have to. (she nods) So whatta you say we start all over  and you tell me exactly what the  fuck is goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SUNSET BOULEVARD – MORNING As we BOOM DOWN from a massive billboard for the movie  Bonaparte starring Martin Weir as Napoleon and begin trac with Harry's eight-year-old, battered Mercedes... INT. HARRY'S CAR – SAME TIME Harry drives, all the while gesturing with a lit cigarett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys, my investors, they run a  limo service, came to me originally,  put money in a few of my pictures  and did okay, they're happy. So they  come in on another deal -– this was  back a few months ago when I was  planning what would be my next  picture, about this band of killer  circus freaks that travel around the  country leaving bodies in their wake.  The characters, there's this seven- hundred-pound fat lady who has a way  of seducing guys, gets them in her  trailer –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at him. Chili takes away his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to tell me how you  fucked up without sounding stupid,  and that's hard to do. Let's just  get to where you're at, okay? You  blew the two hundred grand the limo  guys gave you in Vegas on a basketball  game and you haven't told 'em about  it. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're not the type of guys  would take it with any degree of  understanding or restraint. The first  thing they'd do is break my legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that on the brain, Harry. If  you're so scared of 'em why'd you  take their money to Vegas to begin  with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I need half a million to buy  a script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blockbuster. But quality. No mutants  or maniacs. This one's gonna be my  "Driving Miss Daisy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mr. Lovejoy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mr. Lovejoy"? That's the title?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bad when you know what it's  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pulls to the curb, faces Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray Saffrin, guy who wrote it,  did all my Grotesque pictures, had  it in a drawer for twenty years. He  shows it to me one day, tells me  he's got a star interested, would I  produce it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry points across the street to the Cafe Med where we s a RED FERRARI convertible parked out the front. We see MA WEIR and a WOMAN with jet-black hair sitting at a table..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two time academy award nominee, Martin  Weir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Weir. He played the mob guy  that turned snitch in "The Cyclone".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of his best parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, his best part was the cripple  gay guy that climbed Mt. Whitney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ride the Clouds". Good picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch Martin and the girl a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a rock star. Every day, same  time, they come down here and have  breakfast. He has the egg white  omelet; she has the banana pancakes.  He sits facing west so he can see  his billboard. She faces east so she  has an excuse to wear the shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pulls out, starts driving again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Murray has this shrink, who  also happens to be Martin's personal  trainer's shrink. Murray gives the  shrink the script and the shrink  gives it to Martin's trainer who  reads it to Martin while they work  out, and Martin flips. Loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is Murray. He and a few  other blocked screenwriters went  river rafting down the Kern a few  weeks ago. Murray never made it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart attack. Apparently they brought  a couple hookers along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods, looks up at an ANGELYNE billboard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris, Murray's widow, finds out  about this Martin Weir thing and  says since Murray and I never had  any written contract, she wants five  hundred grand for the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're thinking what if I was to  put you next to my dry cleaner. Ask  him if he wants to invest his money  in a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, or I'm thinking what if some  tragic accident were to befall the  widow Saffrin -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna pop her, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I could talk to the limo guys.  Tell 'em to leave you alone for a  while. Make the point in a way they'd  understand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, I probably know 'em better  than you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you get out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see how we get along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. PARKING LOT – DAY BO CATLETT, black, tall, put together in a tan outfit: su shirt, tie, lies on the hood of a BLACK STRETCH LIMO, his back against the windshield, reading Daily Variety, a hea proclaiming "BONAPARTE STANDS TALL AT THE B.O." We hear t sound of an AIRPLANE and he checks his watch. He casually folds the newspaper as a 747 screams past dir overhead and we... PULL BACK TO REVEAL... LAX – DAY As Bo Catlett pounds twice on the fender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – DAY Bo Catlett walks through the terminal. We hear the arriva of the Miami flight announced over the PA as Catlett stop at one of the gates. We see a plane pulling into the gate through the glass as Catlett checks out the other people waiting to greet the  flight... Like, for example, the YOUNG DUDE in jeans and a wool shi hanging out. Bo Catlett studies him a moment, then sits down in one of the chairs. He looks over at... A BIG MAN, bearded, wearing a loud Hawaiian shirt, and  carrying a three-year-old GIRL in his arms. The girl lick an ice-cream, spilling some on Daddy's shirt... Bo Catlett looks over as disembarking PASSENGERS start co through the gate. As a LATINO MAN gets off the plane and glances around. He looks uncomfortable in the loose-fitting suit, like a mig dressed for Saturday night. The Latino Man lays his TICKET ENVELOPE on top of the tra container near the gateway... INSERT – TICKET ENVELOPE The name "Y. PORTILLO" printed on the outside. The big ma with the little girl picks up the ticket and walks away. As the Latino Man heads straight for Bo Catlett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say nothing to me. Sit down  and act like you're waiting for  somebody supposed to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fock you taking about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hitting the word hard, like Tony Montana in "Scarface".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nobody know me here, man. Give  me the focking money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Now be looking. Man over  to your right in the blue wool shirt  hanging out... the other way,  derecho...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett hunches over to rest his arms on his thighs, s that the Latino Man is now between him and the dude in th wool shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a federal officer, most likely  DEA. He moves his leg look for the  bulge. You savvy bulge? That's his  backup piece... Hey. Try it without  looking right at him if you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Latino Man, trying to be cool about it, checks out th dude in the wool shirt. Sure enough, there's a bulge down near the guy's ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous now) Yayo. Portillo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Yayo, you know he's there,  now forget about him. Now I'm gonna  get up. Soon as I'm gone, you sit  down in this same seat I'm in. You  feel something under your ass it's  the key to a locker where your half  a million is. Along with some product  we're returning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous now, Yayo is staring at the guy with the wool shi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suppose to give me the focking  money yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett gets up, adjusts his suit jacket, smoothing th long roll lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to be cool Yahoo. I told you  where it is. Do it how I told you  and have a safe trip home. Or as you  all say, vaya con Dios, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett walks off, leaving Yayo sitting there, confuse now, not quite sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: HAND HOLDING TICKET ENVELOPE
dialogues.text: The name "Y. PORTILLO" written on the jacket. PULL BACK TO REVEAL... BAGGAGE CLAIM – DAY Where the Big Man in the Hawaiian shirt waits by the caro His LITTLE GIRL HOLDS THE TICKET ENVELOPE. The man grabs case from the carousel and walks to the door. He tears th baggage claim stub from the envelope and hands it to the  SECURITY GUARD. EXT. BAGGAGE CLAIM – DAY As the Big Man and the little girl walk to the black stre parked at the curb, RONNIE WINGATE, an aging surfer in a  suede jacket and running shoes, holds the door open for t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fucking clockwork, eh Bear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cuss in front of Farrah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear hands the case to Bo Catlett who sits in the bac of the limo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Bo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ronnie gets in back with Bo Catlett, The Bear puts his daughter in a toddler seat up front, then gets behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HARRY'S OFFICE – DAY Two stories, part of a block of white store fronts on Sun near La Cienega. INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – DAY Light filters through venetian blinds, illuminating a des stacked with folders, magazines, scripts, papers, unopene mail, hotel ashtrays, a brass lamp, a clock and two  telephones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once asked this literary agent  what type of writing brought the  most money and the agent says, 'Ransom  notes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili stands looking over some of the old photographs as  Harry goes through the mess on the desk. There are some o Karen, Harry with a much younger, blonde Karen. Harry wit giant bugs, Harry shaking hands with mutants and maniacs, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is... "Mr. Lovejoy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry hands a script to Chili. Chili examines the cover, first time he's ever held a movie script. He opens it to middle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovejoy sits behind the wheel,  watching the bar across the street,  getting his video camera ready for  action... (looks up) What's he doing? Following a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it. It's a grabber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks out the window as we see a long black stretch limo pull up to the curb down on the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry? I think your investors  are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HARRY'S OFFICE – SAME TIME As the Bear opens the door for Bo Catlett and Ronnie... INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – SAME TIME As Harry moves away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili tosses the script on the desk, moves between a pair fat red leather chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Harry, make sure the limo  guys sit here, not over on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is tugging the string to lower the blinds behind th desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No leave 'em up, we want the light  in their eyes. I'll be at the desk...  but don't introduce me, let it go,  just start talking. You're gonna be  here, behind 'em when they sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be looking at you. They don't  know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, they're wondering,  who's this guy? You don't tell 'em.  Understand, Harry? Do not tell 'em  who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry glances off as we hear RONNIE SINGING down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the year 2525... if man is still  alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do I say to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say any more'n you have  to. You say, 'Well, I'm glad you  assholes stopped by, so I can set  you straight.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If woman can survive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell 'em the movie's been  postponed. Say, till next year, if  you want. But don't tell 'em why or  what you're doing. Understand, Harry?  You don't tell 'em anything about  Mr. Lovejoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the door opens. Chili sits behind the desk, watching two of them come into the office. Ronnie singing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They may find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks about the office... at the old photographs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, what year is it, man? We enter  a time warp? I feel like I'm back in  Hollywood of yesteryear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry waves them right into the two cracked red leather c facing the desk. Chili watches as Catlett comes first. Si down, he nods to Chili who ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat... right over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie sits down in the chair and hooks one leg over the  arm, swings it up and down, his motor running on some  chemical. He too stares at Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my associate, Chili Palmer,  who'll be working with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry already forgetting his instructions. Chili can't be it. The limo guys nod to Chili and Chili nods back, trying to catch Harry's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make sure there's no  misunderstanding here. Despite rumors  you might have heard, your investment  in Freaks is as sound as the day you  signed your participation agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie has his face raised to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you, but where the fuck  are you, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Chili) What I been wondering is where's he  been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, where've you been? We haven't  heard from you lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry comes around to stand at one side of the desk, his  back to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been off scouting locations.  Interviewing actors in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili's gaze moves from Ronnie the fool to Bo Catlett the dude, the man composed, elbows on the chair arms, his han steepled in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main thing I want to tell you,  the start date for Freaks is being  pushed back a little, a few months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stops bouncing his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe longer. We need prep time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry? Bullshit. We have an  agreement with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna make the picture. I've  just got another project to do first,  that's all. One I promised this guy  years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili shakes his head, he can't believe he's hearing this Ronnie sits up straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see your books, Harry.  Show me where it is, a two with five  zeroes after it in black and white,  man. I want to see your books and  your bank statements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ronnie? Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. Ronnie looks over. So does Bo Catlett for that matt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a piece of a movie, that's  all. You don't have a piece of Harry.  He told you we're doing another movie  first. And that's the way it's gonna  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. But who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one telling you how it is.  That's not too hard to figure out,  is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie turns to Bo Catlett, the man not having moved or  changed his expression the last few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett takes his time, gives it some thought. He look at Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this movie you're doing first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, let me answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catlett looks at Chili again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first I want to know who I'm  talking to. Am I talking to you, or  am I talking to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, smiles) You can talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. So let me put  it this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's between them. The guy studies Chili, thinks abou whether or not to make a move, when Harry steps in, reach over the desk and picks up a script...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the project, "Mr. Lovejoy".  I'm not trying to pull anything on  you guys. This is it, right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Harry, wonders if there's a way to shut hi up without punching him in the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mr. Loveboy"? What is it, Harry, a  porno flick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the script. Harry backs away, holds the sc to his chest. Bo Catlett notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. It's fluff. Nothing  you'd be interested in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett eyes him a beat, then pushes out of his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, you think we go to see your  movies? I've seen better film on  teeth. Makes no difference to me  which one our money's in. So how  'bout you take our twenty points out  of "Freaks" and put 'em in this other  one, "Mr. Loverboy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You positive about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a different kind of deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett nods, gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then be good enough to hand us  our money back, or you think about  us coming in on this new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Friday, man, or you're fuckin'  dead as disco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie opens his coat so that Harry can see a gun tucked his belt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett gives Ronnie a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time, Harry. (closes Ronnie's jacket) We're not animals. Are we, Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett glances once more at Chili then follows Ronnie out the door. Harry stares at the door a moment, senses C staring at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, maybe I wasn't clear.  But I thought... I told you to keep  your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to tell 'em something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never say anything unless you have  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili shakes his head as Harry sits down in one of the ch fumbles for his cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me you want these guys off  your back. Next thing I know, you're  saying yeah, maybe they can have a  piece of Mr. Lovejoy. I couldn't  believe my fuckin' ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd think about it. What does  that mean? In this town, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the difference between you  and me, Harry. I say what I mean. I  want something from someone, I ask  'em straight out. I want Martin Weir,  I go get Martin Weir. I don't fuck  around with his trainer's shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His shrink's trainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me back to my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LAX – DAY As a plane touches down on the runway... INT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – SAME TIME Yayo, now soaked with sweat, is still here. He stands wat a row of lockers. He stares at one of them...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER
dialogues.text: The number C-18. We PUSH IN...

dialogues.speaker: YAYO
dialogues.text: Starts to move for it... then looks off at...

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A SUIT
dialogues.text: As we quickly TILT DOWN to the guy's ankle, looks like a  bulge there. We then... WHIP PAN TO...

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: Dressed casually in slacks and a blouse. We TILT DOWN to ankle, hmmm, is that a bulge? We... WHIP PAN TO...

dialogues.speaker: A TENNIS SHOE
dialogues.text: Tapping to some unheard rhythm and what looks like a bulg near the ankle. We TILT UP this time to reveal a LITTLE K listening to a walkman.

dialogues.speaker: YAYO
dialogues.text: Obviously losing it now, rubs his eyes and quickly walks to a row of payphones... EXT. KAREN FLORES' HOUSE – DAY Chili's minivan is parked outfront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been? I been callin' all  over for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S HOUSE – THE STUDY – SAME TIME Chili sits at the desk on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) Ray Bones is looking for you. He's  got some kinda bug up his ass, can't  sit still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BARBER SHOP – DAY Tommy on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to say I told you, but I did.  I told you don't start nothing with  him that time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said don't say nothing and I  didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you just broke his fuckin' nose  instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna start that again? You're  just like him, all you got room for  in your brain is one fuckin' thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is he came by the barber  shop, all fuckin' undone, wanting to  know where you were staying in Vegas.  I told him I don't know. I still  don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he know I was in Vegas? You  tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm in L.A. now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going into the movie business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? You wanna  be a movie star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about producing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you gonna do that? You don't  know shit about making movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the producer has to do  much, outside of maybe knowing a  writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chil? I think you're fulla shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S ENTRY WAY – SAME TIME As Karen, dressed as a B-movie queen, press kit under one arm, steps inside, freezes as she hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...call me soon as you know when  Ray's coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. STUDY – SAME TIME Chili is scribbling something on a piece of paper as Kare comes into the room. Chili looks up at her as he hangs up smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Karen. How ya' doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to come by, apologize for  coming into your house like I did  last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme get this straight, you broke  in again to apologize for breaking  in before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... you left the patio door  open. You gotta stop doin' that, all  the nice things you got around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well make sure you lock it on  the way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough day on the set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent all day crawling out of a  grave. The costumer kept bitching  'cause I was ripping my nylons –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripped nylons work. Makes the shot  more real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding him) ...That's what we finally decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in "Bride of the Mutant", when  you played the whole end with that  torn top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. When you turn to the camera to  tell the alien mother that her time  on earth is finished... when you  give us all that look, Joan Crawford  wishes on her best day she had that  much presence. Not even in "Mildred  Pierce" -– which by the way was a  better book than a movie -– did  Crawford even touch the intensity  you had in that look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Yeah... that was a good scene. I  mean, for a horror movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For any movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I'm better than what I've  been doing the last ten years, walking  around in a tank top and fuck-me  pumps, waiting till it's time to  scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, can you scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's a real gift. (beat) I'm just saying it'd be nice, one  time in my career to get the chance  to say one great line. You know,  like in that Bette Davis picture,  "Cabin in the..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Cotton".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know when Bette comes up  to the guy on the porch, gives him a  flirty look and says, 'I'd kiss you,  but...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I just washed my hair.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a great line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you stopped making movies  with Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I married Martin. That was a full- time job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read Harry's new one? He says  it's the best thing he's ever read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must mean after "Slime Creature  3".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That why Harry came over last night?  See if you could help him get Martin  in his movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's dreaming of a forty-million- dollar production he'll never get  off the ground with a star he'll  never sign. With or without my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry told me Martin loves it, he  flipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well Martin is known for his  flipping. He flips over a script,  and when the time comes to make a  deal, he flips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, I'll stop by Harry's  office and pick up a copy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out of your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They consider each other a moment... until Chili finally  checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I gotta have a talk with Leo,  my runaway dry cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. See how your story ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. (then) Listen, "Touch of Evil"'s playing  near my hotel. You wanna go check it  out? Watch Charlton Heston play a  Mexican?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks caught, doesn't answer right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go, then turns back to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'He tried to make love to me and I  shot him.' (then) Another great Bette Davis line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at him. Surprised. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BEVERLY HILLS HOTEL – NIGHT Leo Devoe, dressed in a sporty plaid ensemble, complete w little matching hat gets out of a cab, and walks to the f entrance. He tips the doorman, gives him a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a good evening to you, too, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOTEL HALLWAY – NIGHT As Leo the high-rolling dry cleaner bounces down the hall unlocks his door... INT. LEO'S HOTEL ROOM – NIGHT Dark. Leo enters, heads for the bottle of Chivas on the d Has one straight out of the bottle, ahhh, before pulling fat wad of cash out of his jacket, tossing it on the desk like it's change from the cab fare. He then takes off the jacket, unbuttons the shirt, reache for the Chivas again, when we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crash. Something glass hits the floor. Probably the Chiva bottle as Leo nearly has a fucking coronary... Leo looks over as Chili turns on the light behind him. Bu what catches Leo's eye is the BRIEFCASE sitting on the co beside Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't think you're that dumb,  leave over three hundred grand in  the closet, underneath the extra  blanket, but I guess you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know where else to keep it. (then) Where would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here a while, what's wrong  with a bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They report it to the IRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't open an account, Leo, you  put it in a safe deposit box. Dip in  whenever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo nods in his sporty hat and undershirt, thinking it ov what to do the next time he scams an airline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up twelve grand today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From when? You left Vegas with four- fifty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're down to three-ten in the  case. You must've cooled off quite a  bit since you got here.
