dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's another tip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo looks away, raises his preshaped plaid hat and recock it, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Fay, wasn't it, told you about  the money. She tell you my whole  life history, for Christ's sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't let her if she tried. Why  I'm here, Leo, basically, is to save  your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? By taking my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can keep what you won today.  That's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo sits down in the arm chair, stares sadly at the brief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you got this far,  you're so fuckin' dumb. But now you're  through. I'm gonna explain to you  why and I hope you're not too dumb  to understand what I'm saying. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones is now the man you're  dealing with. Ray Bones finds out  what you did, he's gonna want  everything you have. And when I say  everything, I mean even that sporty  little hat if he wants it. Then after  he takes all you got, he'll most  likely hit you with some kind of  heavy object if he doesn't shoot  you, just so you won't tell on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili lets that sink in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do that. Take your stuff or  hurt you. You have three-ten in the  case, right? I'm gonna take the three  hundred you scammed off the airline,  but the rest of it, the ten grand?  I'm gonna borrow that and pay you  back sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo's squinting at him now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take all my money, but you're  borrowing part of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At eighteen percent, okay? And don't  ask me no more fuckin' questions.  I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the briefrase as he rises from the sofa and L gets out of his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you won't know where I am. I  don't even know where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find you, Leo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili reaches for the door, opens it and looks back at Le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave a trail like a fuckin'  caterpillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HALLWAY – SAME TIME As Chili starts for the elevator. Leo steps into his  doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What's this eighteen- percent-a-year shit? You want to  borrow ten, the vig's three bills a  week. Fifteen for the vig plus the  ten, that's twenty-five big ones you  go a whole year, buddy! You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili stops, turns around. As he starts back, he sees Leo scared look just before he slams the door shut. Chili shakes his head, starts back for the elevator. EXT. GRIFFITH PARK – NIGHT Chili drives a dark road up into the park. He rounds a co and we see an explosion of light up ahead as we come upon

dialogues.speaker: A MOVIE SET
dialogues.text: Chili pulls in behind a row of trailers. He gets out of t car and heads for the set where Harry is now looking up a the sky and yelling at someone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's anyone gonna see anything from  way up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Chili. Hi. (looking up) You're fifty feet in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIRECTOR -– early twenties, dressed like a frat boy - sits on a crane about fifty feet above the set...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. I'm gonna boom down real fast,  get a subjective p-o-v.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I talked to Karen. She's  gonna think about helping you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but whose point of view?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean, whose point of view;  The audience's point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down here. I wanna talk to you.  Come on... right now... (to Chili) She's gonna talk to Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's thinking about it. I just need  the key to your office. I just told  her I'd pick up a script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry tosses Chili a key-ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the red one. Take it off the  ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits down in one of the director's chairs that sits off to one side. He starts to take the key off the ring..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name Vicky Vespa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks up at a bored-looking ACTRESS standing there a blood-soaked nightie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you, is your name Vicky Vespa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get the fuck outta my chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits forward, sees her name printed on the back. He gets up. As she sits down, we see an ICE PICK sticking out the oth side of her head. Chili sits back down next to her in the chair with HARRY ZIMM on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the director) What're you doing? I thought I told  you to get down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid nods to the camera operator who lowers the crane we BOOM WAY UP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these camera moves and weird  angles and shit are gonna distance  us from the emotion of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What 'emotion'? Girl just got stabbed  in the ear with an ice pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's scared! Fear is an emotion! (then) Look, kid, if you remember anything  from your time working with Harry  Zimm, let it be the three key words  to filmmaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid fiddles with the crane controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What three words, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick 'n' Save.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, Pick 'n' Save.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry turns so the rest of the crew can hear him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm gonna tell you a little story,  happened to me years ago when I was  so broke I had to go to the Pick 'n'  Save over on Vine to buy a lousy  candybar for my dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches the crew stop what they're doing and listen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing in line waiting to pay  my two bits when I overhear this  lady, call her Mildred, talking to  the cashier about a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Director gives a look to his assistant like 'Jesus, y believe this shit?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Mildred says to the cashier, 'I  saw the new Streisand picture.' (gets into it the way  Mildred did) 'God, I just love it at the end when  she brushed Robert Redford's hair  off his forehead the way she did  when they were together, and the way  they gave each other this look that  said they still loved each other,  but knew they couldn't be together.  That look was so... romantic.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, Harry. So what's the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she did not say was, 'I just  loved the way the director moved the  camera so much it made me fuckin'  seasick.' All she cared about was  that look. All she remembered was  that look. And why do we remember  things in movies? Because we can see  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's right in the guy's face now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... keep this fuckin' camera down  here on the ground and shoot this  scene, so we can see what the fuck  is goin' on, before I get someone  over sixteen to fuckin' shoot it for  you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks over to Chili, sees Chili sitting there. Chil tosses Harry his key ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your keys, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta my chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HARRY ZIMM'S OFFICE – NIGHT As Chili pulls out front, gets out of the minivan, he loo up, sees a light on in Harry's office. INT. CORRIDOR – NIGHT Chili walks down the hallway, dark except for a light on the end of the hall... INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – NIGHT Bo Catlett, reading glasses, script open in front of him, looks up from Harry's desk as Chili steps into the office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't bad, you know it? This  Mr. Lovejoy. Needs a better ending  but yeah, I can see why Harry wants  to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili says nothing, sits down in one of the red leather  chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand I knew Harry was lying,  saying this wasn't any good, but  holding on to it, man, like you have  to break his fingers to get it from  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, I was just wondering  what I was gonna break of yours to  get it away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett smiles at him, doesn't give up the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just explaining to you what I'm  doing here. Case you think I come to  rob the place, rip off any of this  dusty old shit the man has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never make you as a burglar, not  in that outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett sits back in the chair a moment, watches Chili light a cigarette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry called you his associate, but  what does that mean? I never heard  your name or read it in Variety or  The Reporter or anyplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what he said, I'm his associate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must bring something heavy to  the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett picks up a piece of paper off the desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here you're getting Martin Weir  for the part of Lovejoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're getting Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, come on. How you gonna do  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put a gun right here... (touches the side of  his head) ...and I tell him, 'Sign the paper  Marty or your fuckin' dead.' Like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder, would that work? (then) You know who I see for Al Roxy? Harvey  Keitel. The man could do it in his  sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey Keitel. Yeah. Maybe. He was  pretty good in the movie "Fingers".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed that one. Or, hey, you know  who else? Morgan Freeman. You know  Morgan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Morgan Freeman. But he's a  colored guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? Where's it say in this script  he's white? Color is what the part  needs, man, somebody to do it has  some style. The way it is now, Ronnie  could do it, play himself, some  cracked out asshole. (then) So whatta you think of the script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo watches as Chili picks up a copy of the script, begins flipping through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Title's the first thing's got to go.  And the guy's name. I mean, even  this writer's name, Murray Saffrin  is better than "Lovejoy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you on that. And don't you  think it needs a good female part?  Increase the romance angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili flips through the script, sees a name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Ilona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get something going there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Ilona? You know how old Ilona  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's... young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young? She's fuckin' nine-years-old,  same age as Lovejoy's kid. Bernie.  One she calls Bernard. Have you read  the script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I read it. I was just thinking  you could make her older. We might  even be able to get Karen Flores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been out of movies a few years,  but she's good. Real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett studies Chili a moment, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm thinkin'? (leans forward) You wanna make the girl older. I  don't like the ending. We could do  that, you and me, sit down and write  the script over where it needs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili flips through the script a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to write one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to know. You have an  idea, you write down what you wanna  say. Then you get somebody to add in  the commas and shit where they belong,  if you aren't positive yourself.  Maybe fix up the spelling where you  have some tricky words... although  I've seen scripts where I know words  weren't spelled right and there was  hardly any commas in it at all. So I  don't think it's too important.  Anyway, you come to the last page  you write in 'Fade out' and that's  the end, you're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all there is to it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits forward, stabs out his cigarette, exhales into Catlett's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do I need you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think I can be of service  on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we need a ride somewhere,  we'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NUART THEATER – NIGHT As Karen walks up to the box office. A Touch of Evil on t marquis. INT. MOVIE THEATER – NIGHT Not so full. Chili sits in the middle, watching the final scene as Orson Welles gets blown away, falls into the oil river. He can't take his eyes off the screen... Karen comes in, starts up the aisle, looking for Chili. S spots him, just as he mouths the dialogue along with Marl Dietrich...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was some kind of man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen smiles, decides to wait a moment. Chili, lost in th movie... keeps mouthing the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it matter what you say  about people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Tanya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tanya/Marlene Dietrich resumes her slow walk away, Kar sits down at the end of the row. People start getting up leave. Chili turns to a GUY a few seats away from him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy gives Chili a look, puts his arm around his DATE, and quickly starts up the aisle so that Chili can now see Karen sitting there at the end of the row...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been here the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just caught the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, they start up the aisle together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Welles didn't even wanna  do that one. Some studio made him do  it. He owed 'em one and all his own  movies lost money. (walking out now) But, hey, sometimes that's when you  do your best work, you got a gun to  your head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NUART – NIGHT As Karen and Chili exit the theater, stand there a moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a copy of the script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already read it. Harry left a copy  at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's not horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the title. Or the main  guy's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Harry'll make a great team. (then) I'm gonna make a deal with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There a part in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to act in it, I want to  produce it with Harry. Especially if  I help him get Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That why you came over here, to ask  me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does anyone want to be in movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday, you were a loan shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was never much into it. All that  bullshit having to do with respect.  It's bad enough having to treat those  guys like they're your heroes, having  to smile when they make some stupid  remark they think's real funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think the movie business is  any different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well... I like movies. I figure  if I help Harry make one, I'll find  out what you have to do outside of  have an idea and raise the money.  That doesn't sound too hard. I was  in the money business and I get ideas  all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to Martin tomorrow  morning. I told Harry I'd meet you  and him at Abiquiu afterward. (opens her door) This might work, you never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there, watching her drive away. EXT. HARRY'S APARTMENT BUILDING – NIGHT Just above Franklin in the Hollywood Hills. A realtor mig call it Chandleresque. We call it old and cheap. INT. HARRY'S APARTMENT – NIGHT Continuing on the old and cheap theme. Harry stands behin the wet bar pouring himself a strong one. He looks at him in the smoke-tinted mirror squares, downs the drink in on and pours himself another. A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Harry looks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lower) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves to the door and opens it to reveal DORIS SAFF fiftyish, fur coat, hair up so that we can see the nifty  necklace. She leans in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Zimm. You look like a wet kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she plants one on him. Walks into the apartment. Look good for her age. Hell, for any age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, aren't you gonna offer me  whatever it is you taste like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris goes to the window. Harry goes to the bar, pours th each a drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a spectacular view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, lovely. Last night I watched  two guys carjack a Camaro down on  the corner of Argyle there. (hands her the drink) What do you want, Doris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drinks, never taking her eyes off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss Murray, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. He was a helluva good  writer. And I would know. I discovered  him. Made him what he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What he was, was a hack, couldn't  get a job writing for anybody but  you. (off Harry) I'm being honest. He was a lousy  writer, but he was a good husband. I  just didn't know it until too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry finishes his drink, pours himself another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, twenty-twenty hindsight  and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry takes a big, noisy pull off his drink as she moves the bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate being alone. The house is so  quiet. So lonely. It needs... (studies him) A man's touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, she opens up the fur coat to reveal that s wearing nothing but a garter belt and high heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice garter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets her drink down, moves in, wraps her arms around neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how I feel about this,  Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching down) You seem to feel fine about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean morally. Murray was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him... Harry pulls back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this means you've reconsidered  our deal on Mr. Lovejoy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But now that you mention it, I  did talk to a handsome executive at  Paramount the other day... who just  happened to get his hands on the  script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what'd he have to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said if Martin's interested, I  could get a half a million for it  easy. But don't worry, Harry, I'm  still giving you until Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How honorable of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she backs away, gives him a hurt look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. If you want me to go, just  say the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at her a moment, decides...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And pulls her as close as we then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HOLLYWOOD HILLS HOME – NIGHT We hear laughter, rock and roll as a NUDE WOMAN dives int bluelit swimming pool and swims the length... We then TILT UP to a HOUSE ON STILTS above this one and s the lone figure of Bo Catlett standing on his deck. EXT. BO CATLETT'S HOUSE – NIGHT The shimmering yellow grid of the city in the background, Catlett, barefoot, bathrobe, leans on the rail of his dec watching the folks frolic twelve stories down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, man, I don't wan' no  focking key. I wan' the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BO CATLETT'S DECK – NIGHT Bo Catlett looks inside where Yayo paces back and forth. Bear reclines on a chaise lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Yayo? You gonna smoke, get the  hell off my seventy-bucks-a-yard  carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yayo steps out on to the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you where the money is. All  you gotta do is go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll tell you something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you know, huh? Wait here  a minute, Yayo, I be back directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yayo leans against the railing, cuts a 'now that's the wa you get things done' look at the Bear. He lights a cigare looks OFF SCREEN and freezes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fock you doing with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett holds a big .45 out in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you out, Yahoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and shoots Yayo in the chest, the gun going off loud, round knocking the little Latin man back against the rail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead focking center, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yayo, a stupid look on his face, stumbles backwards, over the railing. The Bear reaches for him, but it's too late. EXT. HOUSE DOWN BELOW – SAME TIME The group down here is too stoned to notice the little  Colombian who falls from the deck high above like a sack dirt, then slides partway down the slope. EXT. BO CATLETT'S DECK – SAME TIME The bear looks over at Bo Catlett... who now calmly stare down at the motionless form of Yayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, now someone's gotta climb down  there and get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to shoot him, Bo. We  coulda just beat him up some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? The way the man just  went right over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett takes a sip of his drink, looks at the railing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get Chili Palmer up  here. You fix my railing to give way  like they do in the movies. Then I  invite the man out here, have a look  at my view. Get him to lean over the  railing, see all the naked people  down there... a tragic accident,  officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, that's the lamest idea I've  ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm bored, Bear. I wanna  make movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what's the point of living  in L.A. if you're not in the movie  business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett leans on the railing, looks down at Yayo again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I mean high up in it. (turns to Bear) That's why Harry's gonna make Mr.  Lovejoy with me, not Chili Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lovejoy? That's cute, Bo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter what it's called,  Harry's got Martin Weir and it's  gonna be big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all sound big at the talking  stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MARTIN WEIR'S HOUSE – MORNING Karen pulls into the driveway in a convertible BMW. As sh checks her make-up in the REARVIEW MIRROR, we see Chili p up behind her in his rented minivan. She turns around, fr and quickly gets out of her car. He gets out of the van... holds up a Star Map...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's actually accurate. I  bought it for ten bucks from a kid  in a lawn chair on Sunset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to wait for me  with Harry at the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili points to a star on the map...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, here it is... Martin Weir's  house... right across the steet from  George Hamilton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look to the front door where a tall, skinny WOM with wild, jet black hair stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes bounding down the steps, runs over and gives hi hug... Karen can't believe what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Nicki now. I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. (to Karen) We know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen smiles: 'How 'bout that.' Then looks at Nicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen. Shit. I didn't see you there.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen starts to answer, but Nicki's already hustling Chil inside... INT. MARTIN WEIR'S HOUSE – DAY White everything. Way off in the background, a view on to the huge backyard. A pool man cleans the pool. A gardener blows the leaves. Martin's extensive photography collection lines the walls Chili steps inside, checks some of them out: most of the  photographs are of Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin will be out in a minute. (to Karen) Chili was the only one at Momo's  didn't hit on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like my hair? (reaches up, touches  it) Black like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice. Especially under your  arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow this makes Karen feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin won't let me shave. I guess I  fill some need. Brings him back to  the sixties or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen turns as we hear a TOILET FLUSH somewhere OFF SCREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks OFF SCREEN) Speak of the devil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili follows her gaze and we see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he comes down the stairs, checking  the front of his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Karen spot each other. Both look uncomfortable for fraction of a second, then Martin hurries over to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen. Wow. Look at you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her and hangs on, leaving Nicki and Chili standin there like idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm. You smell terrific. (to Nicki) She always smelled so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Neat. (then) Martin, this is Chili Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesh, a pleasure, Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili's a gangster. Ran a club I  used to play at for another gangster  back in Miami. How is Momo these  days anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen fights a smile. Nicki nods solemnly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bummer. (then) Well, I'll let you all get to your  movie talk. Chili, make sure you say  good-bye before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: PORTRAIT OF MARTIN WEIR
dialogues.text: Done in cracked oils, the whole bit. PULL BACK TO REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN'S LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Martin, Karen and Chili all sit on white couches. Martin checking out Karen, nodding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sitting here, I'm looking at you  and I'm having these flashes. You  know, flashbacks, of memories. (touches her hair) Of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and I'm wondering, how did it  go wrong? How did it all... slip  away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It' didn't slip away, Martin, you  did... when you went off to fuck  Nicki in the middle of my birthday  party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin brings his hand back, nods, lost in thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was a good party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Marty, you were good in  The Cyclone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. It was a beautiful role. All  I had to do was find the character's  center, the stem I'd used to wind  him up and he'd play, man, he'd play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks like she wants to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you had it down cold. Watching  you in the movie, if I didn't know  better I'd have to believe you were  a made guy and not acting. Even the  fink part. I never met a fink and I  hope to God I never do, but how you  did it must be the way finks act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few weeks before shooting, I went  back to Bensonhurst, just to listen  to you guys. See, I'm Italian, but I  grew up in Tarzana. So I wanted to  pick up your rhythms of speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talk different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more like your attitude. Your  tone, your speech patterns demonstrate  a certain confidence in yourselves,  in your opinions, your indifference  to conventional views.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like we don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kinda. Anyway, once I have the  authentic sounds of speech, the  rhythms, man, the patois, I can  actually begin to think the way those  guys do, get inside their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili exchanges a look with Karen who sits back now. Read to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm one of those guys you  mentioned. I'm actually one of 'em.  What am I thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks at Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying  an actual metamorphosis takes place.  That wouldn't be acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at Martin, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't know what I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. Though I have to say  I'm curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like to tell me, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking of a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One we're producing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what? Wiseguy money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin cracks himself up. Karen and Chili crack up with h Karen leaning into Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this was a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Chili keeps looking at Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, I'm not connected to those  people anymore. Not since I walked  out of a loanshark Operation in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? The pressure got to  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure? I'm the one applied the  pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits back. Karen is starting to enjoy Chili's handl of Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an actor, you like to pretend.  Imagine you're the shylock. A guy  owes you fifteen grand and he skips,  leaves town. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches as the movie star hunches over, narrows his shoulders. For a few moments he holds his hands together front of him, getting a shifty look in his eyes. Karen sh her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm doing Shylock instead of  a shylock. Okay, what's my motivation?  The acquisition of money. To collect.  Inflict pain if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen watches as Martin stares at Chili, his expression  gradually becoming deadpan, sleepy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy owes me fifteen large and takes  off, I go after him. The fuck you  think I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is Karen, for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want you to look at me the way  I'm looking at you. Put it in your  eyes, 'You're mine, asshole,' without  saying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're telling me, you're tired?  You wanna go to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. How about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're squinting like you need  glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks away now, fighting a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. I'm thinking, You're  mine. I fuckin' own you. What I'm  not doing is feeling anything about  it one way or the other. You  understand? You're not a person to  me, you're a name in my collection  book, a guy owes me money, that's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin nods, gives Chili a nice dead-eyed look. Karen is  thoroughly enjoying Chili's manipulation of Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I think of you, asshole.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turn it on when I confront the  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you haven't found him yet. (then) The guy took off for Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen looks at Chili as he sits back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's wife tells you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ABIQUIU RESTAURANT – DAY Two floors, the upstairs with a railing overlooking the b Harry, a drink in front of him, sits in a big corner boot upstairs. He checks his watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks up to see Bo Catlett, dressed up as usual,  standing there with the Bear, wearing a Hawaiian shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo. I'm great. Listen, I'm expecting  some people –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be makin' some big deals,  doin' lunch in a place like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on a few things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hear you bagged Martin Weir  for Mr. Lovejoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, this town. Word gets around,  doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry chuckles, takes a sip of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili Palmer told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's smile goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. When he called me over  to your office to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili Palmer showed you my script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was wondering why he should  do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MARTIN WEIR'S HOUSE – SAME TIME Martin is leaning forward... Hooked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife sues the airline. (nods) This is a gutsy babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-looking, too. (turns to look at her) Like Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili smiles at her. Martin leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do I meet up with the husband  and give him the look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple. You have to be  careful. There's another guy that  comes along, a hard-on you owe some  money to. A mob guy. Wants to take  you out anyway, on account of a past  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili stops; he doesn't know what else to say. Martin wai then looks at him a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that point, basically, that has  to be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell me the rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well actually, Martin the movie we  came to talk about is Mr. Lovejoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We understand you read the  script and like it... a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refresh my memory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ABIQUIU – SAME TIME Harry drains his drink. Bo Catlett exchanges a look with Bear, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Harry, how would you like to  get your hands on five hundred grand?  You pay me back at your convenience,  no interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want in return is to work on  the movie with you. Fact I already  got some ideas on how to fix it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett signals the waiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout another one for Mr. Zimm.  A double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna just give me five hundred  grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk about that, Harry. But  first I gotta know, how'd you hook  up with Chili Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MARTIN WEIR'S HOUSE – DAY Karen, Martin, and Chili walk out to the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme talk to Buddy, set up a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lufkin. His... agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Karen knows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm intrigued, yeah. You know what  might help you, take a look at the  Cylone again, the way a visual fabric  is maintained even while the metaphor  plays on different levels. Hey –- (nods to minivan) This your ride, Chili?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili follows Martin over to the minivan, opens the door him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I like it, I'm high up, I can  see everything, you know? It's the  Cadillac of minivans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (then) Mind if I take it for a spin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ABIQUIU RESTAURANT – DAY Bo Catlett and Harry are laughing as Harry, very drunk no finishes another drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was watching Letterman, huh?  Sneaky, that Chili Palmer. (signals the waiter,  then) So, he ever find this dry cleaner,  the one with all that money on him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett and the Bear look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he did and he ain't givin' you  a penny of it, help you out. Not the  way I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at Bo, can't believe what's happening to his  life, thinks a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming I go along with this, when  can I have the five hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you want it. The money's in  hundred dollar bills inside one of  those jock bags, you know? In a locker  at the airport, waiting to be picked  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was waiting out there on another  deal, one that didn't go through;  one you don't want to know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry shakes his head, looks around the restaurant. Bo an the Bear exchange looks, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the kind of thing you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another glance at the Bear, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I was thinking you could  send your boy Chili Palmer. He gets  busted or hit on the head you aren't  out nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Bo Catlett calmly slides an ORANGE KEY acr the table to Harry. Harry stares at it. It has the number 18 printed on the flat orange part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the magic number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they all look...

dialogues.speaker: DOWNSTAIRS
dialogues.text: As Chili and Karen enter the restaurant. Chili checks out the bar, sees they aren't there, then looks up at the  railing... keeps his eyes up there as he says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili moves to the staircase, now sees the Bear in his  Hawaiian shirt standing a few steps from the top. Chili gets within three steps of the guy and stops, but  doesn't look up, keeps his eyes fixed on the man's gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to meet my associate,  the Bear. Movie stuntman and champion  weightlifter, as you might've noticed.  Picks up and throws out things I  don't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili doesn't move, keeps his eyes on the man's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think you ought to turn around  and go back to Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili slowly moves his gaze up through hibiscus until he' looking at the man's bearded face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're a stuntman. Are you any  good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear grins and turns his head to the side, as if too  modest to answer and will let Bo Catlett speak for him. This makes the next move easier... the guy not even looki as Chili grabs a handful of his crotch, steps aside and y him off the fucking stairs. The Bear yells out of pain and fear as the beefy guy roll all the way down the stairs to land on the main floor, a feet away from where Karen now stands. Chili keeps watching until he sees the guy move, then loo up at Bo Catlett who's now coming down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for a guy his size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili continues up the stairs to where Bo Catlett stands  beside the table. Chili unbuttons his coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you a deal. If you can get  out of here before I take my coat  off, I won't clean the floor with  you, get your little costume all  messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen watches now as Bo Catlett puts a hand in his coat  packet, steps right up to Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know me. You only think  you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo walks past Chili, goes down the stairs. Chili watches Bo Catlett helps the Bear get to his feet. They leave the restaurant, the Bear looking over his shoulder at Chili. Even Karen is looking at him differently now as they slid into the booth with a now shocked, rapidly sobering Harry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough business this movie business.  I may have to go back to loan sharking  for a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry doesn't say anything. Karen looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, what're you still doing with  those guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He happens to be loaning me five  hundred grand, no strings, I write  any kind of agreement I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he giving you a check or cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash. It happens to be waiting right  at this moment in a locker at the  airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A locker at the airport? Jesus Christ,  Harry. Tell me you're not really  that stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's setting you up. You pulled  out of their Freaks deal so he's  paying you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that right? I'm being set up?  Then how come Catlett said I should  send you out to get it, since you  haven't done a fucking thing for me  since you got into this... except  showing Bo Catlett my script?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Karen, smiles, shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Harry, I'm wrong. You're not  the one he's setting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, at least Bo's invested in  three of my movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, we spoke with Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'We?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at the two of them, differently now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he wants us to talk to Buddy,  set up a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meeting with who? You and Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man's in town two days, thinks he's  David O. fucking Selznick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Chili look at each other as Harry finishes his  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how 'bout it, Mr. Selznick, do I  make my deal with Bo? Or you gonna  finally help me out, have a word  with your dry cleaner when you find  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about Leo's money, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, if I gave you Leo's money  you'd have Ray Bones all over your  ass and then you'd be in a whole new  kinda trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Barboni. Guy from Miami, owns  Leo now that Momo died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is Momo? Jesus, these  fucking names...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, Harry, tomorrow  morning, when the airport's crowded,  I'll go check it out. If I don't see  a problem, I'll pick up the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't get my hopes up, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry thinks a moment, lays the key on the table, but kee his hand on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I oughta talk to this Ray Bones  character myself. See if he wants to  invest in my movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waste your time, Harry. The  guy's not much of a movie fan. Now  c'mon, gimme the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry finally lifts his hand. EXT. HARRY'S OFFICE – NIGHT A light on upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones. B-O-N-E-S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – SAME TIME Harry sits at his desk, the phone cradled to his ear, a h empty bottle of scotch in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) I show a 'Dem Bones Barbecue' in  Dade County, but that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wait a minute. That's not his  real name. It's uh... uh... yeah -–  try Barboni. B-a-r-b-o-n-i.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RAY BONES' APARTMENT – NIGHT We start CLOSE ON A TELEPHONE... The PHONE RINGS and we B UP to reveal a CLOSED DOOR across the room... INT. BATHROOM – SAME TIME Ray Bones nests on the can, humming off key, reading Weir Tales, Martin Weir's autobiography. He looks up, listens the PHONE RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone KEEPS RINGING. Bones thinks about it a moment,  then tosses the book aside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck fuck fuck fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. FRONT ROOM – SAME TIME As Bones bursts out of the john and grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Phone to his ear, Harry downs another drink, sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Barboni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the guy they called Ray Bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? I'm the one telling you  the way it is, okay, asshole? That's  who I am. Now you want your three  hundred grand or don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What three hundred grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three hundred grand a guy named  Leo Devoe scammed off an airline.  The three hundred grand Chili Palmer  now has in his possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. This gets Bones' attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm here. I just don't like  the anonymous crap. It means your  either chickenshit or not for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, trust me. I'm very for  real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for Harry Zimm, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Zimm. The man happens to be a  major Hollywood player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's because you've never  been out've fuckin' Miami, dipshit.  Maybe it's time you got on a plane,  flew out to L.A. and took a meeting  with Mr. Zimm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones sits down, trying to put this together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, this Zimm guy asking for  some kinda finders fee, that what  we're talking about here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Zimm doesn't ask for dick. Zimm  tells you the way it is... or else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else use your fucking imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry hangs up at the other end. Bones stares at the phon INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – SAME TIME He sits there a moment, also staring at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then realizes his hands are shaking, grabs the bottle pours the rest of the scotch down his throat. EXT. LAX – SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – MORNING Busy. Travelers moving along the sidewalk. Here comes Chi he enters the terminal and we... INT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: ROW OF LOCKERS
dialogues.text: All with keys sticking out of them except one. We push in that one... C-18.

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: Stands between rows of lockers on either side of him. He  studies them a moment longer, then looks up at the ARRIVA MONITOR. He starts writing something on a CARD as we push past him... pushing in on #83 from NEWARK... INT. AIRPORT GIFT SHOP – DAY As Chili buys an L.A. LAKERS T-SHIRT and a BLACK CANVAS  ATHLETIC BAG. He pauses to check out the magazine rack, M Weir is on the cover of everything including his hardback autobiography "WEIR'D TALES". He grabs a copy... Chili puts the book and the T-shirt inside the athletic b puts that inside the papergift shop bag, and then looks  around...

dialogues.speaker: SCRUFFY LOOKING KID
dialogues.text: Eighteen or so, checking out the skin magazines as Chili  comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to make five bucks, take  you two minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid looks at him, but doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go over to those lockers over  there and put this in C-17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid still doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a surprise for my wife. But you  have to do it quick, okay? While  she's in the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like it makes sense, so the kid nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili gives him the paper bag with his purchases, a five  dollar bill and three quarters. He watches as... The kid walks over to the row of lockers... puts the quar into C-17, opens it, puts the stuff inside, pulls the key and then walks back over to Chili, and hands him the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. AIRPORT – DAY As a plane touches down... INT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – DAY As Chili watches the last few passengers come off the pla He watches them come through the gate until he's standing there by himself. Okay, he turns and walks down the aisle now to the bank o lockers three high where C-18 is just about in the middle He looks both ways, takes his time until a group of peopl pass behind, giving him a screen, giving him just time en to open C-17, grab the black athletic bag, and close the  locker. Chili gets about ten yards down the aisle, heading for  daylight, when a BLACK GUY IN A SUIT comes towards him an stops right in his path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a BIG GUY IN A PLAID WOOL SHIRT next to him, same guy we saw when Bo Catlett was here. And Christ, ANO GUY now, this one down the aisle, talking on his hand rad The Black Guy has his I.D. folder open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis. Drug Enforcement. These are  Agents Dunbar and Morgan, would you  come with us, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Curtis turns and starts off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's follow him and behave ourselves.  What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chili walks off with the D.E.A. guys we see...

dialogues.speaker: RAY BONES
dialogues.text: Coming out one of the gates. He looks at a GUY holding a  square piece of cardboard that reads "MR. BARBONE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Barbone? Welcome to L.A. I'm  Bobby, your driver. You have a good  flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts walking) I hope you drive better than you  fucking spell, jackoff. My name's  Barboni, not Bar-bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ray Bones then walks off, we see coming out a differen gate...

dialogues.speaker: THREE COLOMBIANS
dialogues.text: All in dark suits. Two big guys in sunglasses flanking on smaller, older guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go to the hotel first,  Mr. Escobar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get my focking money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SMALL AIRPORT OFFICE – DAY Chili stands there while Curtis opens Chili's wallet and  looks at the driver's license while Dunbar in the plaid s pulls the Lakers T-shirt out of the athletic bag, feels a inside. The agents glance at each other without giving an kind of sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in Miami?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing in Los Angeles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the movie business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an investor, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a producer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a card in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. I just started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches Curtis pick up the note with the Newark Fli number and arrival time written on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate your telling me what  this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a John Doe warrant here. I can  strip-search you if I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I strip-search him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big guy puts Chili against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread your legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing at the airport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to meet my wife, but  she wasn't on the flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you live in Miami, was your  wife coming from Newark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a fight and she left me, went  back to Brooklyn. I asked her to  come out here, you know, thinking  with a change of scenery maybe we  could get back together, and she  said okay, but evidently she changed  her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife a Lakers fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm a fan of everything that's  L.A. I love it out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over his shoulder to the give the guy a smile. C doesn't return it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili moves to the table to collect his things. Curtis wa him then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, you recall the number of  the locker you used?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was C... I don't know, sixteen or  seventeen, one of those. Why? You  looking for anyway, a bomb or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something shouldn't be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get the attendant to  open all the lockers and take a look.  Maybe you'll find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea. I'll think about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'd do. (looks right at Curtis) Make sure I got the right guy next  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out've here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FREEWAY – DAY The usual L.A. traffic. A black caddy in the middle of it INT. CADDY – SAME TIME As Ray Bones looks out a tinted window at the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever wanta go to the beach, here's  the freeway you take we're coming  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live in Miami and you want to show  me a fuckin' beach? The sun ever  come out here, or you have this smog  all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the smog's the reason we  have such beautiful sunsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they say, huh? What a  buncha fuckin' bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. AIRPORT PARKING STRUCTURE – DAY Chili glances about, makes sure no one's around, then pul the key for the 'right' locker out from a crack in the  pavement, near the stairwell. He then goes up the stairs EXT. AIRPORT PARKING STRUCTURE – DAY

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Where the Bear, in his trademark Hawaiian shirt is standi beside Chili's car. He straightens up as Chili exits the  stairwell and walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how I could've missed  you with that shirt on. It's the  same as the other one you had only  the hibiscus are a different color.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you didn't have the key with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd be standing here? You  set somebody up and you want it to  work, it has to be a surprise. Can  you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spotted them, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at him, the guy's either dumb or making  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, did you see it work in some  movie you got beat up in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to ask you for that key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, the setup didn't work so you  want the key back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catlett says if you don't open the  locker the deal's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious? This is how you guys do  business? I can't believe you aren't  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear keeps staring, but doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's no fuckin' way I'm  gonna give you the key, outside of  you point a gun at my head. Then we  might have something to talk about.  Now step away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a gun. Where is it? If  it isn't on you, it's around here  someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili shakes his head, tired of this, but still feeling a little sorry for the guy. He looks off in a kind of thoug way, turns to the Bear again and kicks him in the left kn hard. The Bear stumbles, hunching over. Chili grabs him by the  hair with both hands, pulls his head down and brings his knee up into the guy's face. This straightens him and now Chili hits him high in the belly as hard as he can, right under the rib cage. The Bear sucks air with his mouth open trying to breathe, helpless now and in pain. Chili takes him by the arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down on your back. Come on, if  you want to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets the Bear down on the concrete, straddles his  midsection and reaches down to lift him up by the waist o his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take deep breaths through your mouth  and let it out slow... that's it,  like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear starts to breathe okay again. He checks his teet now, feeling his nose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bear, look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your boss I don't ever want to  see him again. He made a deal with  Harry and a deal's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear nods, closing and opening his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you hanging around with a  guy like that for? You were in the  movies, right? A stuntman? What's he  ever done he can talk about? You  feel okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout when you went down the  stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear touches his thigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I pulled my quadriceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... how many movies you been in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About sixty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit? What're some of 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – DAY Harry is passed out with his head on the blotter when we  hear someone POUND ON THE DOOR. He jerks upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Zimm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -– who is it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, his hair a mess from sleeping on it, looks up at t door as it opens to reveal Ray Bones standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dipshit who's never been out've  Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry wakes up quick, nearly wets himself as Bones then  casually steps into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Barboni. Well. This is surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrambling now to play it the way Chili taught him, Harry quickly gestures to the red leather chair arross the desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Have a seat. Right here in  this chair right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ray Bones sits down, Harry moves to the blinds and ope them. Problem is, the sun's setting, so there's no glare at all Ray indicates the nice red sunset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the fuckin' smog's the reason  you have such beautiful sunsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry just smiles, sits down at the desk, things already going too well, about to get worse... INT. WINGATE MOTORS OFFICE – SAME TIME The walls are covered with posters of Porsches and Ferrar the kind you can buy at the carwash with severely titted  chicks sprawled on the hoods. Bo Catlett is behind a big  wooden desk on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean, he faked them out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. AIRPORT PAYPHONE – DAY The Bear, sort of half doubled over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew it was a set up. He was ready  for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess still in the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess? You mean you don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett looks into the outer office as a car pulls int the garage. Three dark-shaded gentlemen step out of the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear, I'm going to call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WINGATE MOTORS OFFICE – DAY Bo Catlett hangs up, gets to his feet as the men all look into the office now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Escobar. What a surprise. Welcome  to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can now see that one of the Latinos is older, the othe two, younger, are his bodyguards. MR. ESCOBAR, the older, meaner one... steps into the office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my nephew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yayo. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett stiffens... Uh oh. INT. GARAGE – DAY As the two back doors of a limo slam shut. There's half d other limos wedged in here. INT. LIMO – SAME TIME Bo Catlett sits in the back, wedged in between the two  bodyguards, neither of whom has removed his shades. He fa Escobar on the opposite seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my sister's kid. No papa. Not  too bright. Personally, I think he's  a retard. I only gave him the job as  a favor for my sister, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Family. I know how that goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes up here with our product.  He suppose to come home with five  hundred thousand dollars. He never  shows up. Meanwhile, my sister's  going crazy calling me all the time  worried about him. Me, I just wanna  know what happened to my focking  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know. I gave the man  his money, sent him on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave him the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave him a key to a locker that  had the money in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why would you do that? Put the  money in a locker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because there were a zillion DEA  guys hanging around the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat) A zillion, huh? That's a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escobar studies him a moment. Bo Catlett shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe your nephew panicked, took  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your partner, the jumpy one?  Why isn't he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's around someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear he's around Palm Springs.  Dealing our product. Product we sold  to you for five hundred thousand  dollars. (then) Why do you keep talking to me  bullshit? I think maybe I have Ramon  and Ceasar staple your tongue to  your chin. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett barely glances at the bodyguards, smiles the g smile to the Latin guy in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you speak very good English,  Mr. Escobar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to UC San Diego. (then) We're gonna spend the weekend at the  Universal Sheraton. We're gonna take  the tour. See the shark. Check out  the Miami Vice Action Spectacular.  After, we'll come here, get our money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the bodyguards says 'Your nephew' in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, and Yayo, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RONNIE WINGATE'S PORSCHE – DAY As Ronnie zigzags in and out of traffic, giving people th 'look' as he passes... on the carphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fucking nephew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WINGATE MOTORS – SAME TIME Bo Catlett on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get to town, you go straight to  the bank, raid the limo account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already in town, but it don't  matter. We got dick in the bank. We  dumped it all in Harry's movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm sayin' is the man wants his  money and he wants it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HARRY'S OFFICE – DAY Ray Bones impatiently listening to Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about you, Ray Barboni,  owning a piece of a major motion  picture. How big a piece is up to  you. What I'm saying, you could invest  part of the three hundred Palmer  owes you or you could invest all of  it. It's entirely up to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones leans forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Leo Devoe? Where's Chili  Palmer? Where's my fuckin' money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray. Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... Ray's heard that one before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say look at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct. Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones shakes his head, stands up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in one fast move, Ray Bones grabs the phone off the d and slams it into Harry Zimm's surprised face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin look at that, asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones then yanks the phone out of the wall and throws it  down at Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have a peek at that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones pulls a pair of black leather gloves from his p and steps around the desk... begins kicking the living sh out of Harry Zimm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Harry, this is the exact  fucking thing I needed after the  fucking plane flight. My ass fell  asleep... (kick) ...seven times. I need a little  fucking... (kick) ...exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry tries to push himself to his feet, but Ray Bones st on Harry's hands... breaking them... and Harry falls back down... Bones crouches down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a big problem, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones grabs him by the hair, picks him up and throws him  across the room into the wall of pictures, many of them c off their hooks and falling on top of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry... Harry. Don't you pass  out on me. Look up here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, a crumpled heap, looks up and we see his bloody  pummeled face as Ray Bones quickly crosses the room. He s on Harry's neck with his shoe, pinning him to the floor..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry can't speak; his jaw is broken. He looks sad lying  there pinned beneath Ray Bones' shoe, wondering how it al went so wrong. Bones pulls a 9mm from his coat pocket and aims it down a Harry's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. I'm gonna ask you one more  time, then I'm gonna shoot you, you  don't tell me what I wanna know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry just makes a noise. Bones aims the gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
