dialogues.text: Your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones looks over as Ronnie Wingate strolls into the  office... Harry actually looks glad to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Barboni. From Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like that's supposed to mean  something to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie then puts a cigarette in his mouth, eyes Bones. Ha tries to follow what's happening from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man you're steppin' on belongs  to me and my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He owes me money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in line, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough shit, bro. This ain't Miami.  You want something, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fuckball, I don't need your  permission. L.A.'s an open city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie opens his jacket so that Ray Bones can see the .35 Ronnie's got tucked into his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I just closed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones looks at the gun, looks up at Ronnie standing there hands on his hips, holding his jacket open. Bones raises own gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a quick draw... 'bro?' You better  be, your piece stuck way down in  your belt like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you got there... some kinda  pop nine, the fuckin' Fiat of guns,  always jammin' at the wrong time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Bones thinks about that. His confidence a little sh They stand there a moment. Harry raises his hand, makes a gurgling noise as... Ronnie goes for his gun. BOOM. BOOM. BOOM. Harry closes his eyes as Ray Bones shoo Ronnie over and over, knocking the guy backwards until he hits the door, and slumps to the floor. Ray Bones stares at Ronnie a moment, then comes out of hi trance, looks down... quickly steps back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you puke on my shoes, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry rolls over on to his side. Ray Bones deep in though now, picks the telephone up off the floor, sets it back d on the desk, then looks at Ronnie again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry. I need you to do me a favor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry rolls over and looks up at Ray Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to take this gun and put  a pill in the bro over there for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at the dead Ronnie Wingate, slumped up agains the door, staring vacantly back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking, 'Why  the fuck would I shoot him? He's  already dead.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray Bones crouches down beside him. Harry winces as Ray p the gun in Harry's broken hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But see, the cops got these tests,  tell them whether or not a person  fired a gun. And I was never here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks pleadingly at Ray Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand, Harry? I was never  here. You say I was, and I'm gonna  come back here throw you out that  fuckin' window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at the gun, feebly aims it at Bones. Bones fr pushes the gun away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, knock it off, Harry. We don't  have a lotta time here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks up at Ronnie, raises the gun... EXT. KAREN'S BACKYARD – DUSK Beer in hand, Chili sits in a chaise longue by the pool.  Karen watches him a moment from the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a worry in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pool needs skimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes over, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Martin. He wants to have  lunch tomorrow. That is, if you can  make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends, who pays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely not Martin. Movie stars  never pick up the check. They have  no idea what things cost. Most of  them don't know their zip code and a  lot don't even know their own phone  number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at Karen a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet Martin anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unlike the way Nicki met him.  Except it was a wrap party. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm just havin' some  trouble seeing you two together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like Martin much, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I like him. I just think he's...  short. I mean, he's a good actor and  all, but I'm wondering what it was  exactly you saw in Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters, Marty wasn't Martin  back then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling him staring, she keeps her eyes on the sunset, an tries to change the subject...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about your story. You thought  of a title yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Get Shorty? Except that  isn't a movie. That's real life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Chili's Hollywood Adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a different story. I'm still  working on that one, you know, getting  the visual fabric just right. (then) Although I've added to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, puts his drink down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. There's a girl in it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he leans over and kisses her. INT. KAREN'S BEDROOM – NIGHT Karen and Chili lie in bed together. She looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you could be an actor. I  know you're acting sometimes, but  you don't show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I was faking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't mean that. I just meant  in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The're both quiet a moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean a movie star? More  like a character actor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whichever. Let's talk about it  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Chili can't stop thinking about this now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I could see myself in movies  Robert De Niro had been in. Or I  could maybe do an Al Pacino movie,  play a hard-on. But I couldn't see  myself in ones, like say the one  where the three guys get stuck with  a baby. They don't know how to take  care of it and you see these big  grown-up assholes acting cute -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Chili? Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over and kisses him. Is still kissing him when PHONE RINGS. They ignore it, let things heat up as we hea the ANSWERING MACHINE pick up OFF SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in right now. Leave a message  at the beep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEEP, followed by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Karen. It's Doris. Listen, doll,  you might wanna come by Cedars tonight  and visit Harry. He's in the emergency  room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and Karen both jerk upright. INT. EMERGENCY ROOM – SAME TIME As Doris leads Karen and Chili towards the triage area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped by his office to see if he  wanted to take me to Le Dome for  dinner when I saw Harry and this  other man lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris smiles as two UNIFORMED COPS walk past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Todd. Night, Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Chili exchange a look as they follow her into..

dialogues.speaker: THE TRIAGE AREA
dialogues.text: Where Harry lies in bed in a pain-killer stupor. Both of eyes are black. His face is swollen and purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry... My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises a bandaged hand and waves feebly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't talk. He's full of Demerol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry tries to pull away as she runs a hand through his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd he shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Todd -– Sergeant Randall --  a man named Ronnie came by Harry's  office to collect on a debt. He got  rough and Harry shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot one of the limo guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry gives Chili a sad look. We then hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look over as a RESIDENT walks over trailed by se MED STUDENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic) Okay... here we go. Looks like Mr.  Zimm here's got a broken jaw and  some neck trauma to go with those  fractured hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris winks at one of the young med students as the resid then turns to her, Karen, Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, folks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step back as the Resident pulls the curtain shut,  blocking their view of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harry, listen, Martin wanted to  meet us tomorrow at the Ivy for lunch.  I'd cancel, but Martin's going to  Cannes next week, so I think maybe  Chili and I should still go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear HARRY GRUNT from behind the curtain, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, who wants to take a crack at  wiring Mr. Zimm's jaw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and Karen look at each other as we then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BO'S DECK – MORNING

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPH OF HARRY ZIMM
dialogues.text: Standing beside some giant mutant maggot or something. We begin PULLING BACK... now we can read a headline above th photograph, "PRODUCER INVOLVED IN SHOOTING".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bo Catlett sits on his deck reading the newspaper. Fro inside, we hear the front door open and a moment later, t Bear steps out on to the deck, with Farrah, his little gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett looks over as Bear CLEARS HIS THROAT, indicate Farrah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bear. I been calling you, man.  Where you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Bo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Farrah. Hah you, little honey  bunny. You wipe your feet, for you  come in here? Keep Uncle Bo's carpet  nice and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see the paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen it, but I don't believe it.  Says Harry shot Ronnie five times.  Four to the chest and one through  his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His foot. Jeez, poor Ronnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm really gonna miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo throws the paper aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, tonight, later on, I got one  for you doesn't involve any heavy  work. I want you to go have a look  around Chili Palmer's hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I got to take Farrah to  Satan's place down in Costa Mesa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother. Not that it matters  because I don't work for you no more.  I quit. I just wanted to come by,  tell you to your face so there's no  misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... This is the man used to jump  offa high buildings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into air bags. There's no cushion  under what you're doing. I'm out of  it, Cat. I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear. The Colombians are in L.A.  Seems they all upset about their  money. That ain't enough, as a bonus,  it turns out the yoyo was Escobar's  nephew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your problem. You shouldn't've  smoked the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett looks at the Bear, then smiles at Farrah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, honey bunny, come sit  with your Uncle Bo. He hates being  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear watches uncomfortably as Farrah sits down with Bo. B looks up at the Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fact, he hates it so much, if he  takes a fall, he ain't gonna fall by  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett keeps his mouth close to her ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna plea-deal his way out.  Give up this ace stunt man now one  of the West Coast dope kings, if  they go easy on the Cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Farrah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett holds on to her, looks up at the Bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard in the Federal joints they  let you spend an extra five minutes  at the glass with your Daddy on  Father's Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrah. Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farrah slips off the couch, walks over to the Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After this one, I'm out, Cat, you  understand? This is the last time we  talk to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Harry's story about the dry  cleaner Palmer was after? Guy who  stole the three hundred grand from  the airline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking tonight you could go  have a look around Palmer's hotel  room while I go check out Karen  Flores' place. See if he hasn't  stashed it somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) And if we don't happen to find it  under Palmer's mattress or inside  Karen Flores' undie drawer? What  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I told you and meet me  back here at midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he winks at Farrah. EXT. KAREN'S HOUSE – DAY Chili's minivan is parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunset Marquis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S HOUSE – SAME TIME Chili, dressed in his suit, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Palmer. I have any  messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) A Tommy Carlo called. He said to  tell you that a Mr. Barboni was on  his way to Los Angeles and that you  should... (clears throat) ...get the fuck out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili hangs up as Karen comes into the room wearing a bla suit, no blouse underneath, putting on an earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Nice earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. KAREN'S HOUSE – DAY As Karen and Chili walk out to the minivan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda food they serve at this  Ivy place anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continental, but it doesn't matter.  Martin won't order from the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door for her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because a movie star can never order  straight from the menu. They have to  think of something they have to have  that isn't on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE IVY – DAY As the valet drives off with Chili's minivan, a CAB pulls and Harry -– his hands bandaged, his neck in a massive br –- gets out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, what're you doing? You're  supposed to be in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Harry, you look like you belong  in one of your horror movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry waves them off points to himself as he mumbles thro his wired jaw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my project...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then pushes past them and limps up the steps. The hubu on the patio quiets as the three of them then walk up to Maitre D'. INT. THE IVY – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Zimm. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at him, not used to being greeted like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Harry as they're led to a table. Karen si down, looks about at all of the gawking diners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a celebrity, Harry. You shoulda  shot someone a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches Harry try to shake a cigarette out of the p Chili reaches over and helps him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Harry, what'd you think of  Ray Bones as a person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry goes stiff, looks at Chili as he lights one for  himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a guy like Bones would mess you  up like this, break your hands for  no reason. He shoot Ronnie, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at Karen, quickly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing I don't get, Harry, is why'd  you go and do a thing like talking  to Ray Bones. You don't need guys  like him or Bo Catlett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at Chili now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been here a while now and far as I  can tell you're the only person in  town actually making a movie instead  of just talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Harry can answer, we hear a murmur and Chili and K look across the patio to the street, where... EXT. THE IVY – DAY Martin Weir gets out of a NEW MINIVAN, exactly like Chili rental. INT. THE IVY – DAY WE PAN WITH Martin as he stops off to say hello to people sticking their hands out at him to greet him, laugh at hi stupid jokes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill. Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili nods as Martin smiles, leans down and kisses Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetface. You look great. And  mmmmm, you smell good, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits down and fans the air in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you guys mind terribly not  smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili takes another drag, blows it out past Martin. Harry stabs his out, doing the best he can with two broken hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Harry. I hear you had quite an  experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry grunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you're okay. And you  know what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry watches Karen and Chili a moment longer, turns to  Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you rejected me ten years  ago when I auditioned for Eddie  Solomon, the pedophile clown in  Birthday Boy. Had I gotten the part.  I might've gotten typecast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin smiles at his own joke, looks up as the Maitre D'  approaches. Harry turns back to Chili and Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all ready to order? I kind've  have another thing after this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili watches anticipatingly as Martin studies the menu f maybe a second, returns it to the waiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I feel like an omelette.  You think I could have a cheese  omelette with shallots, but with the  shallots only slightly browned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Chili exchange looks, pick up their menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE IVY – DAY They've finished lunch. Chili shares a bowl of ice cream  with Karen. Harry sips cognac through one of those tiny  cocktail straws...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the romance angle in your  story is critically important, that  isn't simply a jump in the sack for  either of them. These two become  deeply in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks up... mumbles through his wired jaw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Once their lives are in danger and  you have the mob guy coming after  them, it not only heightens the  tension, it adds a wistful element  to their love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mob guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry touches his jaw. It hurts to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to consider, I mean, as the  mob guy, this is another man's wife  I'm sleeping with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after all, you have such morals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks to Karen for help here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mob guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to run. But what I hope to  see, they begin to have misgivings  about wanting the money. It becomes  their moral dilemma and they try to  rationalize keeping it, but in the  end they can't. Can they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) The three hundred large. What other  money is there? (then) I should keep quiet, I know, till  I've read the script, but I've got a  feeling about this one. I'm that  shylock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shylock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry winces in pain. Martin turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's already looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you think, Chill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not bad. I think you got it  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry turns to Chili, and back to Martin again. Just now  getting it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, it scares me how well I know  him. I could do this one tomorrow,  no further preparation. (to Karen) Bye darlin'... you really should  think about acting again. I mean,  maybe we could even do something  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Harry looks at Karen who forces a smile at Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it some heavy thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. KAREN'S HOUSE – NIGHT No lights on. Chili's minivan out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S BEDROOM – SAME TIME Karen sits up in bed. Chili lies asleep beside her. She n him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up. Someone's downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits up on his elbows, listens. We can hear the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harry. Downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits up on his elbows, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing the same thing you did to  him, playing Letterman on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Dave. It's a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) You're as bad as Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go. I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, pulls on his pants and the Lakers T-shirt he  bought at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Karen, you have a gun? Any kind  would be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head. He listens to the TV, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's "Rio Bravo".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S STUDY – SAME TIME The big-screen TV on loud, the big .45 in his lap. This t it's a movie, a western, not David Letterman that's on. J Wayne and Dean Martin shooting bad guys as Chili steps in the doorway and looks around; the room is empty now. Chil moves to the television and turns the volume down... He's about to walk out when the dark shape of Bo Catlett  steps into the doorway and startles him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three hundred grand you got from  a little dry cleaner named Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see if I got this right, you  break into Karen Flores' house, ask  me for three hundred grand, doesn't  even belong to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S HOUSE – HALLWAY As Karen comes down the stairs, she can see Bo Catlett  standing in the doorway bathed in the flickering light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me, I'll be on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN'S STUDY – SAME TIME As Chili shakes his head at Bo Catlett...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe the way you guys do  business out here. I can't believe  how fucked up your organization is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett raises the .45...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout I give you to three, then  I organize your fuckin' brains all  over the wall back there. One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you gonna shoot me now, Bo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In just a second. Two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett is about to fire... when we hear a SCREAM. Not just any scream, but a completely professional one that f the house and is all over Bo Catlett so that he starts fi before he's ready, giving Chili time to dive out of the w as... Bo Catlett begins firing all over the room... keeps on fi until without thinking he blows out the TV and the room g dark and the scream stops. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen? You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't talk right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear movement, then the lamp goes on and we see Chili  standing beside the desk looking to the doorway where Bo  Catlett now has his hand over Karen's mouth. She struggle but Bo hangs on to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice scream, lady. You oughta  be in movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Bo. You can have the money...  but it's not here. I have to go get  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Fine. The meantime, I'll just  hang on to her for safe keeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and Karen are looking at each other now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Laurel Canyon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at 8150 Wonderland Avenue. It's  right off Laurel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Karen) Gimme an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BO CATLETT'S HOUSE – NIGHT As Bo Catlett pulls up, drags Karen out of the car. INT. BO CATLETT'S HOUSE – SAME TIME The Bear gets up off the couch as Bo Catlett shoves Karen inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plan B. Here ya go, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves Karen into the bathroom and shuts the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BATHROOM – SAME TIME As Karen shuts the door on him. She listens a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna make a little trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a copy of Martin's hardback Weir'D Tales by the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. LIVING ROOM – SAME TIME Bo Catlett goes over to the stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trade for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money. Fuck. I gotta think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Marvin Gaye OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bo, what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen sticks her head out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know what the fuck he's  doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett points the gun at her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you kidnapped her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen opens the door again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking federal offense,  asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again she shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get life for kidnapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down? We're going away for life  and you tell me to calm down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps Bo's gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ranting) Hell, why not just shoot her? Why  not shoot everybody. Fuckin' shoot  me. Shoot the fuckin' president?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fade on me now, Bear. Not unless  you wanna hold Farrah on your lap in  a room fulla felons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at each as we hear... INT. HOUSE – SAME TIME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this's one of those houses you  see way up hanging over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look over at Chili, standing in the doorway,  lighting a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Karen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods to the closed  door) In the can. That the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili opens Leo's bag so that Bo can see the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo Catlett shrugs, walks over and opens the bathroom door Karen stands there with her arms folded across her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy's got a fucking pink toilet, for  Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's great. Gimme the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you and me gotta get a couple  things straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili walks to the doorway leading out to the deck and tu around. He eyes Bo Catlett a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been shot at before -– once by  accident, twice on purpose. I'm still  here and I'm gonna be here as long  as I want. That means you're gonna  have to be somewhere else, not  anywhere near me or Harry or Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sets the duffle bag down in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your money. Take it and leave  the movie business to the rest of  us, know what we're doing. C'mon  Karen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to leave, we hear a LOUD CLICK as Bo raises the gun, takes a step towards them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke in my house and I have a  witness to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks at the Bear. The Bear won't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only this time, no John Wayne and  Dean Martin shooting the bad guys in  El Dorado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Rio Bravo. Robert Mitchum was  the drunk in El Dorado, Dean Martin  in Rio Bravo, practically the same  part. John Wayne, he also did the  same thing in both. He played John  Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I can't wait for you to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear, you're not really gonna –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear hooks one to Chili's face. Chili drops to his kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear kicks him, sending Chili back into the living ro at Karen's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever fallen down stairs before? It  really hurts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey –-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen moves to help Chili. Bo raises the gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go first, honey? That's  fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear picks up Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him off my carpet, you gonna  make him bleed like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear knees Chili in the gut, then shoves him out on t the balcony. Bo Catlett follows them out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I say, 'I warned him, officer,  but he kept coming at me...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear follows Chili out, hits him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's for the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, he should have a weapon, a knife  or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get it later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Bear hits Chili again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Bear... that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Bear can't stop, keeps hitting Chili. Bo moves up the Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bear... enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear looks at Bo Catlett...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep hittin' him like that, he  ain't gonna look like he broke in  anymore, he gonna look like someone  beat him up and then shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the Bear, holding on to the back of Chili's shir shoves him towards Bo Catlett, who takes a step back, and grabs the rail behind behind him, and drops the gun as he gets a funny look on his face as... THE RAIL BREAKS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flails a moment, grabbing at spare, but then quickly g on to Chili...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear tries to pull Chili back, but ends up holding a  handful of Chili's shirt as both Chili and Bo Catlett go  over the rail together and drop from sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FROM THE HOUSE BELOW – LOOKING UP AT BO CATLETT'S HO As a body falls... too dark to see who... EXT. BO CATLETT'S DECK – SAME TIME As Karen spots THE GUN on the deck as two hands appear on the edge and the Bear rushes forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, gimme your hand... we  gotta get outta here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the Bear, Karen picks the gun up off the deck, poi it at the Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Karen, don't -–

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear reaches down again and BOOM! Karen SHOOTS THE BE IN THE LEG. He cries out, falls back and lets go of...

dialogues.speaker: CHILI
dialogues.text: Who now barely hangs on to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen! What the fuck are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... I'm sorry... I thought  that was... I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes over to the edge... helps the now wounded Bear  pull Chili back up on to the deck. Then they all stand th looking down at Bo Catlett lying in the weeds and scraggl bushes, a hundred or so feet down, not moving. Marvin Gaye singing 'Ain't No Mountain High Enongh' as Ch then steps back, looks at the railing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bear starts taking bolts and nuts, old used ones, out his pants pockets. Wiping each one on his shirt before  dropping it over the side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BO CATLETT'S POV – CHILI, KAREN, & THE BEAR The three of them looking down. Slowly the picture gets b as we then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SUNSET MARQUIS HOTEL – NIGHT As Chili and Karen pull to the curb out front. She looks him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you scared up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't act like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared then, not now. How long  you want me to be scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks off, shakes her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Go get your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CHILI'S ROOM – NIGHT As Chili enters, takes off his suitcoat, drapes it over a chair. He takes his suitcase out of the closet, throws it on the bed, and freezes as...

dialogues.speaker: RAY BONES
dialogues.text: Extending the 9mm at Chili, comes out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need that. You want to sit  down and talk, it's fine with me.  Get this straightened out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones steps further into the room as Chili turns his back Bones, walks to the sofa and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them I was you. I acted stupid  and they believed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings you to L.A., Bones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't insult me. Get up and turn  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili gets to his feet. Bones motions with the gun and he turns to face the painting over the sofa. Bones comes ove and lifts his wallet from his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the dumbest fucking guy I  ever met in my life. Let's see what's  in your pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face still to the wall, Chili shoves his hands in and pulls the side pockets out. Bones turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you should've done was told me  about Leo Devoe as soon as you found  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili looks over his shoulder to see Bones pulling his  suitcoat from the back of the chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause the guy's a customer now,  stupid. His ass belongs to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones lays the pistol on the counter, holds the suitcoat  with one hand and feels through it with the other express changes, his eyes open wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand comes out of the suitcoat with the LOCKER KEY. C sits down on the sofa again; he can't believe how easy th is gonna be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my cigarettes. They're in  the inside pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones throws him the coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones then holds up the key to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-one-eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frowning now. Putting on a show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what this's for, a locker?  Yeah, but where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili sits back to smoke his cigarette, lets it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked the bag at the airport,  when I came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Which terminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Sovereign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found Leo, didn't you? Took the  poor asshole's money and put it in a  locker, ready to go. (looks at him) Why haven't you left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili shrugs. Bones eyes the key a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's no reason you and I  shouldn't get along. Forget all the  bullshit from before -– I don't even  remember how it started. You took a  swing at me over some fuckin' thing,  whatever it was -– forget it. You  owe me some money, right? Forget  that too. But, you don't say a fuckin'  word about this to anybody. It's  strictly between you and me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SUNSET MARQUIS HOTEL – NIGHT As Ray Bones gets into a cab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug Enforcement Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CHILI'S HOTEL ROOM – LATER Chili is on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna speak to the agent in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) What is this in regard to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A locker out at the airport, full of  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili waits. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) Who's speaking please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you. It's an anonymous  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) Are you the same anonymous asshole  called the other day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is a different one. Have  you looked in that locker, C-one- eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pause on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're helping us out. I'd like to  know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you would. You want to chat or  you want me to tell you who to look  for? The guy's on his way out there  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's a reward for  information that leads to a  conviction. That's why I have to  know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get my reward in heaven. The  guy you want has a bullet scar in  his head and is wearing gray shoes.  You can't miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SUNSET MARQUIS – NIGHT As Chili follows the bellboy out of the hotel. He tips th guy, then gets in the car with Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't find my toothbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, then starts the car. EXT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – LAX – NIGHT As Bones, seen only from the back now, gets out of the ca enters the terminal. INT. SOVEREIGN TERMINAL – SAME TIME As Ray Bones, still seen only from the back casually stro through the terminal, playing with the LOCKER KEY in his  hand. Ray walks right up to C-18 and inserts the key, turns it, and opens the locker to reveal a BLACK ATHLETIC BAG sitti inside... Chuckling, he then reaches inside... ...then stiffens as we hear a CLICK as a RED LASER DOT hi him in the temple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones turns his head and we see that it's not the Ray Bon we know, but... an ACTOR, a tough-looking guy with a scar face... WE PULL BACK FURTHER TO REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN WEIR
dialogues.text: Standing there with the biggest fucking gun with laser sc we've ever seen. A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN with the biggest -– we you get the idea -– is standing next to him... She scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets and blood fly as the tough guy pulls a gun from t locker and begins firing wildly at Martin and the Woman a Hare Khrishna's and anybody else who happens to be in the vicinity... Martin, the tough guy only two feet away, calmly aims his gun and pulls the trigger, but nothing happens. He shakes the gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit... not again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!

dialogues.speaker: A SOUNDSTAGE
dialogues.text: Set up like the airport terminal. Martin throws a fit abo the malfunctioning prop as The Bear walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, maybe you should dive or  roll out of the way or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's wrap! We'll pick it  up tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Karen crosses the soundstage, we track along the backs a row of director's chairs with the names... "MARTIN WEIR "HARRY ZIMM"... "KAREN FLORES" and... "CHILI PALMER". Chi stands chatting with BUDDY LAFKIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Martin already told me he loves  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know, Buddy, I don't  think Martin's right for this new  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SOUNDSTAGE – DUSK As Karen, Chili, Harry, Martin, and Buddy all exit the  soundstage. Karen and Chili get into Chili's minivan. As they pull out, we see the name "C. Palmer" painted in space. We then CRANE UP AND BACK as Harry, Martin, and Buddy eac get into their own minivans... and we then...
